bio: I'm a designer at Riot Games collaborating on matchmaking projects with the teams working on League of Legends, 2XKO, Wild Rift, Valorant, Teamfight Tactics, Legends of Runeterra, as well as R&D projects. name: Seth Smith
headline: Senior Game Designer at Riot Games - VALORANT
creator: TRUE
school_1: Savannah College of Art and Design
bio:
Raised in Houston, Texas, Seth S. Smith first discovered he had a passion for games at the age of five. While playing video games he noticed gameplay variations between Super Mario Bros. and Super Mario Land. He fell in love with the possibility of creating his own variations and imagined many new gameplay experiences. His passion for games grew. This led to him becoming a game designer. 

His philosophy on game design is that every game should aim to push the medium forward, innovate a concept, fulfill a need, or find away to be unique. Seth would love to see his work transcend into film, music, and other forms of media.

name: Haiyin Yang
headline: Game Designer II at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
👉 I use my expertise to create the most memorable gaming experiences possible.

══ GROUNDBREAKING ══
I love figuring out how things work in video games, but I’m most passionate about the social, multiplayer, and cooperative elements within them. It’s my firm belief that games should be player-centered and are a powerful tool to bring fun and meaningful experiences to the players because games have always brought the best out of me and my friends, and brought us closer together.

I started playing a lot of video games in college. I found that the interactions between the player and the game systems allowed the games to be a unique form of expression for each individual user. I was impressed by all of my gaming experiences, and while my major in college was digital media (art and programming), my focus shifted to becoming a game designer.

I realized that there wasn’t a legitimate education program for game design. At the time the gaming industry wasn’t so developed. I took extra curriculum classes in 3D art and applied for (and was accepted by) Entertainment Technology Center at Carnegie Mellon University as an artist. I became a game designer upon graduation at Zindagi (now Zynga) games making mobile games. I’m excited to see what I can enhance next!

Content Designing | Live Operations | Product Designing & Implementation | Project Lifecycle Management | System Design | Data Analytics | UX Design | Documentation | Prototyping | Deconstruct | Training Fellow Designers | Game Design | Live-ops (Live Operation) | Product Management | Data Analysis | Content Design | F2P (Free-to-play) Games | Project Management | Social Features Design | Virtual Reality (VR) | Player Generated Content (PGC) | Unity 3D | Unreal | Art: Photoshop | InDesign | Maya | Programming: C | C++ | Video: After Effects | Sony Vegas | Sound: Audition | Google Spreadsheet | Tableau | Balsamiq Mockups | Lucidchart | Visio | Perforce | SourceTree | Hansoft

name: Michael Breese
headline: Senior Game Designer at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
My name is Mike Breese and I am currently a Designer working at WB Avalanche. My background is in Systems Design and User Researcher and have a bit of startup experience wearing many hats. 

I graduated from the University of Utah's EAE program with a Masters in Game Production. Where I led a team to design and release our IGDA award-winning game Hard Light Vector. My undergraduate degree is in Psychology, focusing on Human Factors and minoring in Philosophy. This has instilled in me a love for iterating on ideas, and tweaking designs until they are just right.

	In my spare time, I am a bit of a hobbyist making games. I have published a few games on steam and am currently working on an unannounced AAA project. I enjoy seeing how people solve problems, particularly when working within a team. I love making games, it puts you right on the cutting edge of technology and art, and I get to work with the most amazingly passionate people.

name: Matthew Louque
headline: Technical Game Designer II at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
I am a recent honors graduate of Louisiana Tech University with a Bachelor of Science in Computer Science with concentrations in Cyber Engineering and Video Game Design. 

My interests include software engineering, cyber security, machine learning, and networking. In my free time I enjoy playing video games, playing tennis, drumming, and learning about new technologies.

name: Jenna Minyoung Park
headline: Senior Game Designer at Riot Games / Level Designer
creator: FALSE
bio:
Have been working as a game designer since 2004.
Worked for open world MMORPG and Action RPG genre of South Korean and Japanese game companies in the early stage of my career. After traveling around the world for 18 months I moved to the states. Since then I've worked as a level designer for First person shooter game and other r&d projects.
I love all parts of game design area, but enjoy the most Level design and contents design. 

The great joy in my work is when I see people having a fun time with the game that I dedicated for developing. 
When we are having fun, we open our mind, become positive and want to share the experience with others. That's why I believe that games can be one of the most powerful entertainment tools which can have a good impact on people. 
I will continue a meaningful journey in this industry that shaped me as a game designer who appreciates coworkers, projects, opportunities and life.

name: Michael S.

bio:

(It happened! 🙂)

name: Mindy C.
headline: Technical Game Designer II at Riot Games (Teamfight Tactics)
creator: FALSE
school_1: The University of Texas at Austin
bio:
Hi! I'm a game dev that loves many things... game design, programming, digital art, music, and writing. Professionally, I am a technical game designer— a gameplay designer that works in tech-heavy script systems and C++ game engine code with a software engineering background. I love systems and unique mechanic design! I also tend to have many thoughts about elegant systems and UX.

I'm currently a Technical Game Designer at Riot Games working on Teamfight Tactics sets. On TFT, I design and implement gameplay content, upgrade designer workflows, and bridge knowledge/communication between engineering and design. I’ve shipped several sets of seasonal content to players including trait and champion designs.

I've been a student game dev community organizer, game jammer, doodler, programmer, DJ, cute-game-lover, and spreadsheet enthusiast.

Previously, I was a Computer Science student at the University of Texas at Austin in the Turing Scholars program. I was also previously president of UT's Electronic Game Developers Society from 2018 - 2020, helping to grow an amazing community of passionate student game developers.

name: Bao Nguyen
headline: Game Designer II at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
I am a hard-working Gameplay Designer by trade and a passionate gamer at heart. Throughout my years in the industry, I have gained a wealth of knowledge from numerous disciplines. Whether it was developing heroes, creating new game modes, managing editorial content, or competing in esports at the highest level, I have always went above and beyond in order to excel. 

MOBAs and mobile games are my forte but I am also well-versed in the world of fighting games, RPGs, and action-adventure games. I enjoy breaking down the individual systems that create the gaming experience and studying why they are compelling to players.

name: Carrie Zierath
headline: Game Designer
creator: FALSE
bio:
I believe society’s toughest problems can be solved through purposeful play.

From counting wooden blocks, playing chess with a caretaker, and even cooperating with a random group of strangers in an online game, play can help people grow in ways conventional learning is limited.

If you believe play can make a difference in our lives - let’s chat sometime!

headline: Game Designer II on Valorant

name: Yotam Haimberg
headline: Principal Game Designer at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
I've been leading teams with an emphasis on collaboration and trust. I'm deeply mindful of how many projects I'll be able to work on, so I've learned to value and foster the joy of working together. My style encourages teams to learn how to work better as a unit over time.

As a game designer, I have a deep interest in how game rules and mechanics can lead to players telling their own, emergent stories. I seek out ways to improve my craft, and enjoy discussing even the smallest bit about games, especially if it involves a spreadsheet. The craft of game making excites me and I love to learn.

I run sessions for tabletop RPGs, and can't wait to gather around a table to tell another story.

name: Stephen Mortimer
headline: Senior Game Design Director at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
While going to school at Digipen Institute of Technology, I got an internship at Nintendo Software Technology. I worked there for over 11 years and shipped 8 titles, becoming one of the youngest people to be the Director of a shipped Nintendo title.

I'm now at Riot Games, and have been for more than 6 years, worked on tons of new features and improvements for the popular PC game League of Legends, and now acting as the Gameplay Director for the strategy game Teamfight Tactics.

Being a part of the games industry has always been, and will continue to be very important to me. I want to pursue making the best games possible that people can enjoy, just as I have always enjoyed games.

Specialties: Video game design including levels and game play mechanics, systems and user experience, as well as managing and directing teams to create the highest quality products.

I also stream as a hobby, to improve communication skills and discussions between developers and players. Check it out at www.twitch.tv/mortdog or https://www.youtube.com/c/MortdogTFT

name: Jeff Hamilton
headline: Game Designer III at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
Note: I generally only connect on LinkedIn with people I have worked with, or people I know well in real life and would be comfortable endorsing for a job.

Bio: I enjoy making all parts of games, especially with a focus on how systems, rules, and moment-to-moment implementation details can create strong emotional responses. I've worked on many MMOs, multiplayer adventure games, multiplayer turn-based tactics, and more. I aspire to be a game designer who can really tie all the disciplines of design together.

name: Yuwei Lin
headline: Game Designer for Modes at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
Hi, I'm a game designer at Riot on Modes team. My specialties lie in game design, visual art, and UI design.

As a game designer and multi-media artist, I love to explore connections between video games, art, and education. I believe game has the potential to achieve an artistic expression unique to the game per se. I'm also working to become a game educator in the future. 

My website: yuweilin.org

name: Jared Greiner
headline: Senior Systems Designer @ Riot Games R&D | Ex-Bungie, Mojang Studios, Xbox
creator: FALSE
school_1: University of Southern California, School of Cinematic Arts
bio:
Portfolio: www.jaredgreiner.com

12+ years of experience as a professional game designer. Exceptional technical skills and an ability to consistently help others see the glass as half full.

Experienced in combat systems design, enemy and AI design, combinatorics systems, rapid prototyping, game economies/progression, and post-sale monetization strategies.

Proficient in Unreal Engine 5, Unity, Node and Text Based Scripting (UE4 Blueprints, C#, JavaScript, some C++), Figma, Miro, Confluence, Notion, Photoshop, Premiere, Jira, Azure DevOps, Trello, Agile Scrum, Microsoft Office.

headline: Senior Game Designer at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio: Games for me create experiences and emotions unlike any other medium. This passion paired with my love for computers has led me to a career in video game design. name: Michael Bilodeau
headline: Senior Game Designer at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
In my experience, a Designer's role is often that of the coordinator. They develop a plan for the necessary goal, then distribute it to both art and programming, working alongside everyone to integrate their progress into the final product. Through this, I've learned that everyone needs to be included and updated as the features develop. Organization and two-way communication are extremely important to fostering efficient and inspired work toward the final vision. I believe that managers and leads work best when they focus on how to get the best work out of their team, while maintaining high morale. I'm always looking for ways to improve the process of creating games on which the entire team is proud to have worked.

Specialties: Gameplay Innovation, Game Modes, System Driven Replayability, Event Scripting (even online), Competitive and Coopertative Multiplayer, Feature Breakdowns, Feedback Integration

name: David Smith
headline: Senior Game Designer at Riot Games (R&D)
creator: FALSE
bio:
I am a Senior Game Designer and writer with extensive knowledge of game design, working most recently for Riot Games for their collectible card game, Legends of Runeterra. My primary passion is the gaming industry, which includes writing, producing, developing, publishing, and marketing for mobile/web games. I also have experience working on independent projects, and am a decent Python coder.

I also have a graduate degree in Philosophy and substantial teaching experience.

name: He-Rim Woo
headline: Principal Game Designer at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
AAA Game Systems and Design Concepting.  MMORPGs, Online CCGs and Other Genres.  Reward Systems, Player Flow, Progression and Crafting.  New and Returning Player Retention.  Design, Writing and Scripting.  Pipeline Improvements.  Problem Solving and Design Frameworks.
I am passionate about creating games that are forces for good:  games that bring players joy and solace, games that enable players to connect with each other, games that make player stories possible.  My favorite tools are rigorous and creative system design, analytical problem solving, and insight into psychology and behavior.

name: Thi Detert
headline: Manager, Game Design @ Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
As a leader in Game Design, I apply my passion to create engaging and innovative gameplay experiences for millions of players worldwide. I have over 12 years of game design experience, working on titles such as Forge of Empires and Sunrise Village.

I excel at leading and inspiring game teams, fostering collaboration, and translating game vision into captivating game features and mechanics. I have a proven track record of designing systems, levels, and live events that drive retention, engagement and monetisation. I am always eager to learn new skills, explore new genres, and challenge myself as a creative lead and game industry professional.

name: Mark Sassenrath
headline: Sr Lead Game Designer at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
Senior lead game designer with 12+ years of industry experience, including PC and mobile development, on both R&D and live games. Excited to create games with purpose and impact, on teams that value sustainability, accountability, and empathy.

Specialties include: gameplay design, multiplayer design, systems design, content design, R&D prototype design, game balance, social design, product strategy, management. Skills also include: standard engine editors (Unity, Unreal), scripting/programming (Python, C#, Lua), UX design, tabletop design.

Experienced with cross-disciplinary teams, design-focused teams, and solo projects. Regularly work with production, art, narrative, engineering, sound, UX, visual design, data research, publishing, recruiting. Strongly value diversity, equity, & inclusion.

name: Chris Wallace
headline: Senior Game Designer at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
My name is Chris and I'm a game designer and developer from New York City. I love making games that bring people together and games that help people.

While I've made a wide range of games across many genres and platforms, from a short experience played on the facade of a building to educational games built with React, I seem to have found my niche working on multiplayer games doing level and systems design.

I'm well versed in all aspects of the design process from ideation and prototyping to wireframing and user testing.

I have years of programming experience in both web and games and have quickly learned several new languages on the job. 

I'm an experienced project manager and scrum captain with the ability to see through all aspects of a design and efficiently prioritize tasks to get the job done. 

I'm a teacher. I taught both adults and children kung fu for about 16 years and taught grad and undergrad students at NYU for 4.

My full portfolio is available on my website, cswallace.net. Thanks for stopping by!

name: Samuel Judd
headline: Technical Game Designer at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio: I’m Sam Judd. For the past 4 years, I’ve been building nuclear reactor and rocket technology but I’ve always had a passion for building games. My expertise in designing complex systems and working with highly multidisciplinary teams to help send people to space lends itself well to game design as well. In aerospace, I've developed space nuclear technology and hardware at USNC and then moved on to Blue Origin, where I'm currently working on metal 3D printing and manufacturing process development for rocket engines. As a game designer, I’ve worked on VR, combat, and puzzle games with a mind towards game balance, designing engaging mechanics and creating player satisfaction.

name: Glenn Anderson
headline: Game Designer II at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
My role as a game designer is to bridge resonant fantasy archetypes with compelling gameplay mechanics. I have the fantastic opportunity to design, develop, and shape sparks of inspiration into fully fleshed out champions for League of Legends. 

I graduated from Western Washington University with a double major in psychology and communication studies. My coworkers typically describe me as fun-loving, analytical, organized, and creative!

When not in the office I love to pursue my other passions, such as being an unabashed nerd, 12 year dungeon master, and third dan black belt in hapkido!

name: Elan Gleiber
headline: Senior Game Designer at Riot Games R&D
creator: FALSE
bio:
I take extreme pride in the games I work on as well as the teams I work with, inspiring those around me and fostering a healthy and productive work environment with whomever I work with.


Previously to working at 343i, Elan Gleiber was the CEO and Lead Designer at oddByte LLC as well as Lead Developer at Hashbang Games LLC, a contract game development company based out of Seattle, Washington, USA.

Elan graduated with BAs in Media & Information and Music from Michigan State University (MSU) where he trained in Video Game Design and Development. During his time at MSU, he was employed at the Games for Entertainment and Learning Lab (GEL) where he was a project lead and game designer. While in school he worked on over 10 different games with 6 from concept to completion. These games have ranged widely in platform and genre and have received multiple awards and acknowledgements.

Upon graduating, Elan founded oddByte LLC along with some fellow graduates from MSU. They spent a year and a half finishing development and releasing Rogues Like Us, a Hack n’ Slash rogue-lite game they had started while still students at MSU. During this year and a half, Rogues Like Us was a two time finalist at the Seattle Indie Game Competition and official selection at the Seattle Indies Expo, GDEX, and SIGGRAPH Indies with Intel.

Soon after founding oddByte, Elan also joined Hashbang Games LLC, and quickly rose to a lead developer position. His work at Hashbang focused on rapid prototyping for client contract games as well as systems design, development, and optimization on all titles.

After releasing his game Rogues Like Us with oddByte and working on multiple contract titles, Elan went on to join 343 Industries as a Sandbox Systems Designer.

name: Marc LeBlanc
headline: Game Developer
creator: FALSE
bio:
I am a seasoned Game Software Engineer and Game Designer, have been making computer games professionally since 1992 (and unprofessionally since about 1981).  I consider myself a generalist, but my areas of greatest technical experience include game engine architecture, game logic, simulations, and designer-facing tools. I began my career at LookingGlass Studios, where I was a core contributor to LookingGlass' iconic titles, such as Thief and System Shock. In the 2000's, I served as the CTO of Electrified Games, a small company where I could function in an executive role while still contributing code and game design.  
 
I am always looking for opportunities to use my skills to contribute to the success of creative, ambitious projects. To that end, I am currently working at Riot Games as the Gameplay Technology Lead on an unannounced project. 

I also look for opportunities to lecture and teach game design in industry and academic settings.  I teach a Game Design Workshop at the Game Developer's Conference every year, and have been a lecturer and guest instructor at a number of venues, including Columbia, Northwestern, NYU, UPenn, Penn State, UT Austin, Valve Software and Disney.

headline: Game and Economy Designer
creator: FALSE
bio:
A passionate Game Designer with over 20 years of industry experience and over 20 shipped titles. Skilled as a design lead, economy designer, manager, and director. Looking to help your company make amazing games, now, and into the future.  A proven systems designer, with extensive experience in all areas of design. 


I have shipped many video games as well as being a published tabletop game designer.

headline: Game Designer at Riot Games | Passionate about Creating Immersive Gaming Experiences | Expert in Game Mechanics and Level Design
creator: FALSE
bio: As a dedicated Game Designer with a strong background in creating engaging and immersive gaming experiences, I have honed my skills through various roles in different companies across Australia and Riot Games. With a Bachelor’s degree from a prestigious university in Singapore and a Master’s degree from a leading Australian university, I bring a unique blend of creativity, technical expertise, and a global perspective to my work.

name: Dan Hardison
headline: Game Designer II at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
Game Designer focused on multiplayer character-based live-service games. Proficient in UE4 blueprints and hyper-focused on details, live balance, and character ecosystems.

I've worked on most of Riot's major projects at this point in one role or another:

Wild Rift - Playtest and give feedback on early prototype models of the game to help inform WR's decisions on how to structure their game

TFT - I bought the first ever Pengu gacha transaction over a $5 sticky note roulette (and additionally helped test the game in its prototype phase) 

LoL - Playtested and owned quality as a gameplay analyst for many champions, live balance changes, and preseason updates over a 5-year stint 

VALORANT- Lead design on Agent 25 (Clove) and recently started taking on a role as our lead of Live Balance.

name: Jake Street
headline: Sr Manager, Game Design (TFT Metasystems Design Lead)
creator: FALSE
bio:
Design Manager working at Riot Games on Teamfight Tactics. Before that I was a systems designer on Legends of Runeterra and Project L focused mainly on progression, monetization, and ranked systems.

I am also a lead for Riot's LGBTQ+ employee resource group the Rainbow Rioters, with in-game diversity & representation as my area of focus. 

My background is in Political Science, specifically International Relations.  Always happy to nerd out about things like nuclear strategy, security studies, and international organization.

multiplayer gameplay.

A Game Designer and writer with more than 15 years experience. Started out as a level designer on LA Noire. Moved to system and narrative design with KMMIE. Went indie, co-founding Quest's End Games. Now back in AAA at Guerrilla in Amsterdam.

Passionate about game design, narrative and interactive storytelling.

name: Alina A.
headline: UX Designer II @ Riot Games • Researcher • Archaeologist
creator: FALSE
bio:
Hi 👋🏽 I'm a former archaeologist turned UX Designer, Researcher, Gamer, and MMA enthusiast born to introduce others to the world of Filipino food and good UX. I'm an expert at developing wireframes, process flows, sitemaps, storyboards, and high fidelity prototypes with ease. Conducting usability testing and user research is the backbone of my Masters degree in Anthropology and I have over 10+ years of refining user experiences for companies across a broad range of industries. I'm excited to bring my skills in human-centered research and design to the video game industry and look forward to connecting with like minded professionals in the field!

Please feel free to check out my portfolio below and hit me up via DM or email :D

💜 alinaaquino.com
📧 alinaquino@gmail.com

name: Christian Yetter
headline: Producer at Riot Games with visual and narrative design expertise
creator: FALSE
bio:
With over 6.5 years of experience in the gaming industry, my expertise lies in producing engaging content and designing imaginative games. At Riot Games, I am deeply committed to shaping immersive experiences that resonate with players globally. My work is driven by a mission to innovate within the industry, crafting stories and gameplay that push boundaries. My approach is rooted in a passion for collaboration and excellence, ensuring that every project benefits from diverse perspectives and aligns with the dynamic culture of Riot Games.

In my current role, I lead the production of marketing tactics, managing everything from illustrations to live events. My proficiency with tools like Airtable and Miro, coupled with a firm grasp on production workflows, empowers our teams to deliver captivating content. I take pride in having streamlined production processes, fostering efficient collaborations with translation partners for localization, and establishing robust relationships with vendors, which has been instrumental in our success.

name: Max Grossman
headline: Design Director on VALORANT at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
I am a detail-oriented game designer that excels in fast-paced team environments.  Multiplayer Games have been my passion for as long as I can remember and I am extremely grateful that I am able to work with talented teams to create engaging multiplayer experiences for millions of gamers.  My strong work ethic and exceptional communication skills have allowed me to excel when working with large teams.  

~Project History~
VALORANT - Design Director
VALORANT - Senior Game Designer
The Last of Us 2 - Game Designer
Rocket Arena - Lead Designer
Halo 5: Guardians - Multiplayer Designer

~Skills~
Languages:  C#, Lua, Blueprint, Javascript
Design Tools: UDK, Unity, Game Maker, Photoshop, Illustrator, Excel
Specializations: Multiplayer Design, Mechanics and Systems Design, Progression and Monetization Design.

name: Sean Tan
headline: Game Designer
creator: FALSE
bio:
A Game designer with a huge passion for gameplay mechanics and game flow. I believe that games first and foremost should bring a smile to the player.
• Experienced in mobile game development (Unity3D)
• Solid foundation in Prototyping, Level Design, Mechanic Design
• Research and analysis of game data - Domo/Amplitude/Firebase
• Scripting Languages: C#, Lua, Unreal Blueprints
• Experience with using Excel, Unity3D, Git, mySQL
• Analytic and avid gamer

name: Evan Huang
headline: Senior Visual Designer @ Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
Since 2016, I've specialized in creating story-driven video game visuals that enhance player engagement. By meaningfully employing shape, color, texture, and layout, I bridge visual, narrative, and gameplay, fostering emotional connections and steering the experience toward a purposeful outcome.

------

Currently, I'm working with Riot Games on VALORANT in areas such as:
- Visual Design
- Direction of Visual Design
- Unreal UI Implementation/development
- CGI image creation for UI

name: Justin Yong
headline: Senior Game Designer at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
Hi I’m Justin! Born and raised in sunny Singapore, I have always wanted to be a software developer ever since I read about it in a kid’s IT magazine. My first ever video game was a 5.25″ floppy disk copy of Wolfenstein 3D and I have never stopped gaming since. I have had so many good memories playing video games and it is now my goal to design and create games for others to enjoy!

During my free time, I reconnect with my artistic side by making short films and creating hip hop music.

Programmer.
I first started gameplay programming back in 2005 while I was studying for my Diploma in Digital Entertainment Technology in Nanyang Polytechnic, Singapore. After having completed 2 years of National Service, I furthered my studies in the School of Computing at the National University of Singapore where I graduated with a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science (Interactive Media). Following that, I pursued a Masters of Entertainment Technology at Carnegie Mellon University.

During my studies, I took part in programming competitions and have won various awards including the Singapore’s Successful IT Developers Award in 2009.


Game Design.
Throughout the game projects I have worked on over the years, I have participated heavily on the game design process. Being an avid gamer myself, I take inspiration from the many games I have played and incorporated some of the unique game ideas with some of my own. I have also taken classes in Game Design during my diploma and masters studies.

I am currently fascinated by constrained cooperative gameplay.

name: Jacob Ruttenberg
headline: VO Designer @ Riot Games | League of Legends | Teamfight Tactics
creator: FALSE
bio: As an Associate VO Designer collaborating with a variety of product and discipline teams to create visceral audio experiences, I thrive on the excitement of transforming champions, skins, and game modes into memorable player experiences by harnessing my own passions as a gamer. Earning my MFA in Game Design from USC and now regularly working alongside writers, editors and other sound designers at Riot Games has emboldened my desire for crafting cutting-edge experiences at the crossroads of technology, entertainment and storytelling.

name: Robert Gee
headline: Combat Designer
creator: FALSE
bio:
I am a Senior Game Designer with a focus on combat and skills system. I have over a decade of experience in the game industry as a designer and know my way around several coding languages.

I focus my efforts in design around developing unique gameplay hooks and mechanics to create fun gameplay experiences for players that are also easy to update and understand for developers.  To support these experiences I use my skills in software engineering to create elegant and reusable scripts to solve tricky problems.

I believe that you don't need complex rules to make an interesting game. I enjoy creating simple gameplay elements that can be combined in a variety of ways to generate unique player experiences.

name: Andrew Rubino
headline: Manager, Game Design at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
I love games - I love playing them and I love making them, just as much as I did when I started in the industry over 17 years ago.

In that time I've worked on everything from building enemy behaviors in Mass Effect Andromeda, designing the multiplayer fleet battles in Star Wars Squadrons, to now leading the meta-systems design team on the upcoming Project L! 

I enjoy working closely with teammates, solving tough problems, and creating amazing experiences.

name: Brad Merritt
headline: Director of Game Design
creator: FALSE
bio:
I am a creative and technical game designer and studio director. While I specialize in kid’s & multiplayer games, I have a variety of experience in game genres and demographics. I have been making games since 1998, in a range of roles such as: artist, programmer, designer, and director. I have extensive experience directing internal studios as well as external teams

I love being involved in the game development community as an organizer, teacher, and lecturer.

name: Abby Sherlock
headline: Game Producer at Riot Games / On Camera Host, Voice Over Actor + Director / Forbes 30 under 30 2024
creator: TRUE
bio:
Recovering child actor Abby Sherlock, grew up in South Carolina before attending the University of California, San Diego and receiving her Masters in Game Design at the University of Southern California. Now an internationally recognized games creator, producer and host, she’s been broadcast on the live page of Twitch as a personality multiple times, and led panels with performers from the Final Fantasy series and mentored young girls through Girls Make Games.

Other career favorites include appearing on the E3 2018 ESL Gaming stage, interviewing pro players from CLG: Red plus hosting for the Overwatch League’s Vancouver Titans online content as on camera talent. Besides starting her career at Wizards of the Coast, Geek & Sundry and Nerdist she also served as a Community Coordinator for Blizzard’s former esports brand Tespa. 

She has been able to see the entertainment industry from multiple angles. Most recently her game Heirloom (2020) swept the games festival circuit, winning Favorite Game Developed by a Female Team from the Women in Games Global Awards and being shortlisted for the New Media Writing Prize and Games for Change. As a voice over artist she was most recently heard in BAFTA nominated Blocks (2021). 

Currently, she is involved in Games Production at Riot Games while also hosting, acting and directing voice over projects when she can. Creative Professional and Game Developer with experience in creative development, writing, casting, directing actors and hosting on camera. She has expertise and a passion for producing, storytelling, project management, talent relations, esports, streaming, speaking engagements, event planning, interviewing and community managing. 

Events hosted, staffed, asked to speak or awarded attendee include: USC x Riot Games Panel 2024 (Speaker) PAX East 2024 (Speaker), UCLA Anderson Women in Games Panel 2023 (Speaker),Riot Games Women’s Month Panel 2023 (Host) PAX West 2022 (Speaker), Gen G ChallengHER 2022 (Host), GDC Narrative Summit 2022 (Speaker), Area of Effect 2021, (Host), IGDA Foundation Showcase 2021 (Host), GDC 2021 (Activision Blizzard King Scholar), Area of Effect 2020 (Host), Girls Make Games Fellow 2020, (Speaker) GDC 2020 (IGDA Velocity Scholars Recipient), IndieCade 2019 (USC Games Exhibitor), Supergirl Gamer Pro 2019 (Host), Girls in Gaming UCI: Esports 2019 (Speaker), ESA Foundation Panelist at E3 2019, (Speaker) Girls in Gaming at Riot Games 2019, (Panelist), Supergirl Gamer Pro 2018 (Host) E3 2018 (ESL Influencer)

name: Rick Lesley
headline: Lead Level & Encounter Designer (Senior Manager, Game Design) at Riot Games (R&D)
creator: FALSE
current_position: Lead Level & Encounter Designer (Senior Manager, Game Design)
bio:
Rick Lesley is a versatile game designer based in Seattle, Washington with experience across genres including first-person shooters, third-person adventure games, racing sims and more. He is skilled in level design, mission design, systems design, AI design and combat scripting, and has an affinity for creating complementary gameplay systems and spaces to facilitate exciting, memorable and replayable experiences. 

With a knack for process, Rick enjoys working on designer-facing tools and finding new ways to improve existing pipelines and scripting needs. He enjoys collaborating across departments to bring designs to life and find new and innovative ways to improve the player experience.

name: Heather Conover
headline: Senior Game Design Manager at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio: Heather Conover is a professional game designer who got her start in the industry in 2008 working on games for change. With experience in games for change, casual, mobile and PC games, she's eager to find innovative ways to reach diverse audiences. After shipping 2 major MMO titles for NCSoft and designing systems and UX for cutting edge technology on Hololens, she's shifted her focus onto building new experiences for Riot Games.

name: Mark B.
headline: Senior Visual Designer at Riot Games // VALORANT
creator: FALSE
bio: I'm a Visual Designer with over 8 years of experience in the video game industry and possess a wide range of technical skills in the visual design field which include Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects, Premiere Pro, InDesign, and Cinema 4D. Additionally, I have a bit of experience with game engines such as Unreal Engine and Unity, which allows me to bring a unique and versatile approach to my work. My combination of technical abilities and experience in the industry allows me to create visually engaging designs that help enhance the player's experience.

name: Jacquelyn Liu
headline: Principal Experience Designer (UX)
creator: FALSE
bio:
13 𝐲𝐞𝐚𝐫𝐬 𝐢𝐧 𝐠𝐚𝐦𝐞𝐬. 12 𝐢𝐧 𝐲𝐞𝐚𝐫𝐬 𝐔𝐗/𝐔𝐈. 7 𝐲𝐞𝐚𝐫𝐬 𝐢𝐧 𝐥𝐞𝐚𝐝𝐞𝐫𝐬𝐡𝐢𝐩 𝐞𝐱𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐢𝐞𝐧𝐜𝐞. 𝐀𝐜𝐫𝐨𝐬𝐬 𝐏𝐂, 𝐂𝐨𝐧𝐬𝐨𝐥𝐞, 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐌𝐨𝐛𝐢𝐥𝐞 𝐏𝐥𝐚𝐭𝐟𝐨𝐫𝐦𝐬.

Creative and technical designer with proven ability to lead projects that fulfill both goals and deadlines. Experienced in leading and executing on end-to-end design and development of user interfaces with global teams across PC, Console, and Mobile platforms.

Cross-functional collaboration with product managers, creative director, developers, and stakeholders to conceptualize and execute intuitive and functional experiences across PC, console, and mobile platforms.

A deep understanding of aspects across the game development process.

Personal experience with all aspects of interface development:
- Defining clear design principles and guidelines
- Directing and guiding the creation of experiences
- Prototyping interactive wireframes
- Implementing
- Gathering stakeholder feedback to further improve and refine solutions

Familiar with managing and mentoring external teams.

name: Devin Low
headline: Game Design Architect at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
What makes a game compelling?

As a design leader and as a player, I love games that let you combine lots of little pieces into something more incredible than the sum of its parts. It could be combining cards, moves, items, technologies, tricks, or knowledge. Assembling great game teams is the same way. =D

I've led successful game teams and game designs for 17 years, from mobile free-to-play games to MMOs to digital card games to physical board games. I was honored to be the Lead Designer & Creative Director of Plants vs. Zombies Heroes for PopCap/EA, Head Developer of Magic: The Gathering, and Lead Designer of Marvel Legendary. Two degrees from Harvard got it all started.

Now I'm excited to be working as Game Design Architect at Riot Games in LA!

name: Seren Mason
headline: Game Design Architect
creator: FALSE
bio:
I am an interdisciplinary innovator who has worked on monumental, large scale projects around the world as a creative director, technologist, and artist. Working in creative design direction as part of management, I coordinate teams of people, delivering solutions on budget and formulating a creative roadmap across multiple channels and disciplines.

Synthesizing design, research and development, innovation, strategy, and engineering, I deliver impact at large scale. I apply creativity and experimentation to solve problems at all levels, and produce resonant experiences that hold people’s attention, capture their imagination, and inspire wonder.

I work on the cutting edge of technology, across all scales of digital media: including virtual reality, massive learning walls, video games played by millions, and iconic architectural landmarks.

I have fluency across a wide spectrum of disciplines, facilitating clear communication with partners, collaborators, and stakeholders. As a director, I harness the talents and diverse experiences of others to deliver powerful, dynamic solutions, and self-organize in a way that enables me to work with others as a collaborator and team leader. 

My current focus has been in the video game arena, working with large- and small-scale studios to innovate on immersive, social experiences that resonate with a global player-base.

name: Will Mutch
headline: Senior Game Designer at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
As a Game Designer, my goal in the industry has always been to create new and unique experiences for players to enjoy, and I have been fortunate to have had many opportunities to do so over my career, across PC, console, handheld, and mobile platforms.

I'm always looking out for new and exciting possibilities in the field of game design and development. Feel free to contact me to discuss games, new projects, technology, or just to ramble about Gundams.

name: James Carlton
headline: Senior Game Designer at Riot Sydney
creator: FALSE
bio:
Game Designer, UI Designer and Graphic designer with over fifteen years experience in game development. Equally technical and creative I bring a hugely diverse range of skills and I can work on paper, in engine, in frames, fabric, film or fiction.

Strong Graphic Design and Unreal Engine skills working with blueprints and assets. Former UI designer - 30+ years Adobe experience. Specialise in creating videos using After Effects and diagrams and wireframes in Illustrator and Photoshop. Level Design experience both in engine and Maya/Modo. Reasonable modelling skills and coding ability.

Strong creative writer with a huge passion for military history - specifically WWII and Cold War both historical and technical information on all types of hardware, tactics and weaponry. Exceptionally fast worker with a talent for rapid prototyping and testing.

name: Ronn LeFeuvre
headline: Designer at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
school_1: Art Institute of California - San Francisco
bio:
Since I was a kid I was programming video games and creating short films. Maybe no surprise that I end up in Hollywood, but I do find myself in a lucky situation - I get to do one of the two things that I really love every day at work. Maybe I can get to that second thing someday...

Specialties: PS3, Xbox 360, Wii, PSP and PS2 development, Game Design, Combat Design, Game Balance, Level Design, Layout, Creative Writing, C/C++, OOP

name: Eron Rauch
headline: Writer at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
school_2: Minneapolis College of Art and Design
bio:
Maybe I never stopped loving the weird world of underground fanzines and handmade mixtapes. Even after a decade of building game worlds, chronicling digital media for international publications, and art directing albums galore, there's always still that spark of collaborative DIY play in my approach to every project. 

Highlights:
• Writer in Narrative Support for Riot Games 2018-present, collaborating to build the narrative infrastructure for products across the League of Legends/Runeterra IP.
• Art Director for Angel City Jazz Festival 2017-present, crafting nationally circulated print and digital advertising, branding, and merchandise.
* Member of The Art Newspaper's AR/VR expert panel, reviewing immersive technologies used in the global art world.
* Adjunct Professor in the CalArts Design department, teaching their photography for design class.
• Published over 60 articles on video games, art, and fan culture for publications such as WASD, Gamasutra, FanByte, Killscreen, Der Spiegel, Mechademia, Unwinnable, and Heterotopias.
• Start-up Art Director for Orenda Records, producing 40+ album packages as well as branding, logos, templates, social media assets, art books, and style guides.
• 15 years experience as both a fine art and commercial photographer, crafting projects
across documentary, travel, editorial, live music, and installation.
• Extensive experience making and curating art shows for both institutions and mixed-use spaces. Outlets such as PhotoWorld China, Bijutsu Techo, Financial Times, Hyperallergic, Deutschlandradio Kultur, Voyage LA, and Vice/Motherboard. have featured my projects.

name: Kevin Riach
headline: Senior Game Producer at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
Hard working. Creative thinking. Self motivated.

My name is Kevin Riach, and I'm a video game developer with experience working in a variety of different roles. I always strive to be on the cutting edge of production technology, and pride myself in my ability to work in high pressure situations and meet deadlines. As a designer, I'm always thinking about players first and figuring out new innovative ways to incorporate narrative into games. I'm constantly pushing myself to master something new and be the best at whatever I'm doing. Whether its games, film, television, or any other form of entertainment, my skill set is an asset to your company or production.

name: Karl Abad
headline: Game Producer II on Unannounced Riot R&D Project
creator: TRUE
bio:
Hiya, I'm Karl!

I'm the Producer on the Thematic Development Team for PIE (Player Immersion and Expression aka "Personalization") on League of Legends, where we source new skin thematic ideas and develop them through narrative and visual exploration.

In grad school, I worked on Neon Night Riders (networked capture-and-control game, prototyped in Unity, currently being developed in UE4) as the Lead Designer, UI/UX Designer and Marketing Lead, Pocket Protection (mobile dating sim game for Android devices, focused on HIV and STD-prevention messages as part of the CDC-sponsored GameOn! Challenge), Heroes (a Space Team and Dungeons and Dragons hybrid party game for iOS devices) and other side projects.

name: Zane Lyon
headline: Principal UX Designer
creator: FALSE
bio:
Experience shipping titles on all platforms in multiple engines and genres, including UX and UI for sci-fi and fantasy, notably the multiplayer FPS Evolve, and work as game director for South Park: The Stick of Truth. 

Most recently UX and systems lead on an unannounced melee game for Nexon, overseeing designs for character loadouts and progression, as well as building out the full UX flow for matchmaking, combat, and friend and party, and platform integration. Examples of my process, which include wireframes through to AE motion mockups and UE4 implementation are in the prototype section of my portfolio. I’m comfortable with scripting, blueprints, and taking my UX work to a shippable state that includes art, animation, and illustration.

name: Christopher Martin
headline: UI/UX Designer
creator: FALSE
bio:
Empathy for your audience is the foundation for a relationship between them and your brand. I’m interested in working with you to help build products that really resonate with customers.

Relationship design is what I focus on. Deciding the kind of relationship you want to have with your audience informs the rest of the design process and leads to a richer experience.

Introducing empathy into the design process is a priceless practice. If you’d like to work together feel free to reach out to me anytime!

name: Joshua Parker
headline: Combat Tech Design Lead @ Riot Games | Tech Gameplay Designer
creator: FALSE
bio:
With more than 10 years of experience in game development, I am a passionate and skilled Combat Tech Design Lead at Riot Games, one of the leading studios in the industry. My mission is to design and implement engaging and innovative moment to moment gameplay experiences for millions of players around the world.

As a former Engineering Lead of various teams at Riot Games, I have a proven track record of leading and collaborating with talented developers, designers, and artists to deliver high-quality products. I also have a strong product sense and a keen eye for creating unique player experiences, as demonstrated by my publication on the technology behind Mordekaiser's ultimate ability. I am always eager to learn new technologies, tools, and techniques to improve my craft and create immersive and memorable combat scenarios.

name: Fabrice Condominas
headline: Executive Producer, MMO @ Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
With over 20 years of professional experience and a diverse background spanning industries such as video games, cinematography, and computational ontologies, I bring a unique perspective to my work. 

My experience includes working on major franchises such as Mass Effect and Star Wars, and helping to establish studios like BioWare Montréal and Riot Singapore. I have a track record of building high-performing teams, driving product vision, and leading innovation.

As a senior leader with a broad skill set and a passion for developing new ideas, I always seek exciting opportunities to collaborate and make a positive impact.

name: Christopher K.
headline: Product Leader in the Gaming and SaaS space.
creator: TRUE
bio:
Veteran product leader and designer in the digital and gaming space.  I've created memorable titles and promoted top brands in the tech and gaming industry, with past work in both global franchises and original IPs. I've also consulted and spoken at conferences from Digital Hollywood to San Diego Comic-Con on various topics related to the games, media, and entertainment.

Strengths:
• Business strategy and development of existing licenses and creation of new IPs
• Leading Product teams with a focus on live operations, engagement, monetization, feature creation, and analytics
• Leading development of games and media in areas of design and production process

Specialties:
product management process and leadership,
Live Operations and games as a service,
new business development,
new feature development,
user experience,
monetization mechanics,
virtual economy,
prototype creation and analysis,
brand marketing

bio:

One day I hope to grow up, but hopefully not too soon.

name: Larra Paolilli
headline: Production & Operations @ Riot Games | xMicrosoft, xDisney, xBlizzard
creator: FALSE
bio:
Seasoned leader and manager with over 20 years of proven results delivering immersive games, products and digital experiences for companies including Microsoft, The Walt Disney Company and Blizzard Entertainment. Highly experienced business and product leader with a track record of operationalizing teams to deliver exceptional results internationally and at scale. Passionate about people, teams and telling stories through a variety of technologies to connect with global audiences and positively impact lives.

► 20 years of hands-on experience across product, design, engineering, business and leadership functions within the gaming, interactive and entertainment industry.
► Track record of leading, managing and inspiring cross-functional teams to operationalize and deliver results through a culture of inclusivity, collaboration and process refinement with clear accountability.
► Exceptional and proven ability to build consensus at all levels with key stakeholders, external partners, development studios, tech platforms, carriers, and OEMs - both domestically and internationally.
► Trusted as a stabilizing, motivating leader who is able to promote team health and drive results in an ambiguous environment.
► Deliver innovative, thoughtful experiences and products across a variety of technologies for the biggest franchises in the world, including Diablo, Disney, Marvel, Pixar and Lucasfilm.


EXPERTISE
Team Management, Leadership & Coaching, Talent Strategy, Diversity & Inclusion, Conflict Resolution, Creative Direction, Franchise Development, Innovation and R&D, Product Management, Process Refinement, Audience Expansion, Market Research, Global Strategic Partnerships, Business Strategy, Flexible Business Models

name: Aliyah F. Clayton
headline: Game Producer | Helping deliver games for people to create core experiences together.
creator: FALSE
bio:
Aliyah (uh-lee-uh) Clayton is a producer in the gaming industry whose latest contributions are towards external development for Riot Games such as League of Legends, VALORANT, and Teamfight Tactics.
Previously, Aliyah worked on the AAA FPS mobile shooter game Apex Legends Mobile, which won Mobile Game of the Year (GOTY) awards from Apple and Google in 2022. 

Driven by a passion for games since the early age of seven, they strive to help deliver games that bring people together. As a producer, their goal is to promote psychological safety within every team they manage, especially in a way that highlights the fun in game development and minimizes crunch culture. Aliyah has been recognized by peers for their unwavering commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion in games and on game development teams.

name: Zach Burggraf
headline: Tech Product Management - Video Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
Hi, I'm Zach! For the past 10 years I've dedicated most of my waking hours to understanding how great product teams build successful products. 

As a Product Manager, I believe in early and continuous customer feedback and design iteration throughout the development process. Some topics you could ask me about: dual-track agile (continuous discovery and delivery), user story mapping, how Scrum or XP fits in with modern UX and Product methods, design sprints, rapid prototyping, user testing, and how to build great product teams.

I started learning all of this at Riot Games where I worked on the most played video game in the world, League of Legends. I've also worked on mobile app and web B2C products and done consulting in the public sector. Most recently, I've joined Pragma Platform where I lead product team building B2B solutions to help video game studios power their backend game systems. 

Outside of work, I am an (unpaid) television critic. You can read my annual "Best New Series" lists on my website (www.blackrook.com) or listen to the "Required Viewing" podcast which I co-host with Shams Malik.

name: Drew Stauffer
headline: Principal Creative Director, Marketing
creator: FALSE
bio:
I am a passionate creative leader looking to build and develop an enthusiastic, robust and powerful Digital Content and Brand Strategy team that shares my dedication to producing the highest quality content across all global and media channels.  Maximizing the latest in consumer insights to ensure that we are on trend and message, while continuing to push the envelope and taking risks to be on the cutting edge of the digital marketplace.

Coming from a show business family, I always knew that I was destined to land in the industry. Trained as a Broadway Stage Manager, it was only through a twist of fate that I discovered I was an editor. 

I am currently serving as a Principal Marketing Creative Director at Riot Games.  Leading all creative on the Riot Forge brand and creatively supporting Valorant and the rest of the Riot IP.  

Prior to Riot Games, I spent eighteen years at Electronic Arts as a member of the video department.  Starting as an editor, I climbed the ranks to Marketing Creative Director for the Apex Legends and Medal of Honor franchises. I have worked on such famed titles as Battlefield, Titanfall, Mirror's Edge, Command & Conquer, Boom Blox, Need For Speed, Burnout, Crysis, Medal of Honor and many others.

I was also fortunate enough to take the directorial the reigns of "Castle of Glass", the iconic music video for Grammy Award Winning, Linkin Park.  The video recently crossed half a billion views.  

Other credits include 4+ years as Director of Video Production of FLUXone Entertainment and a year as a Stage Manager at the American Conservatory Theater in San Francisco.

name: Matthew Jones
headline: Senior Software Engineer at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
A Software Engineer with a background in distributed computing, machine learning, and composing software to a gold standard. He focuses on building software that is maintainable, testable, reliable and quickly deployable. With a Bachelors and Masters in Computer Science this developer is driven to build systems that bridge the gap between AI and the consumer. 

In addition to his focus in Software systems, he also has a background in devops. Hes used container based systems like Docker with container orchestration systems like Kubernetes to compose real-time forecasting and imaging systems at scale. 

His background in distributed computing stems from his knowledge of using Spark, scala, and python to build composable systems that perform real time calculations and manipulation on vast quantities of data.

Along with the background in both devops and distributed computing he also has experience working in a variety of cloud computing environments such as AWS and GCP.

name: Stan Zienka
headline: Creative & Design Direction
creator: FALSE
bio:
I am a Creative Director focusing on strategic design solutions for marketing, branding, and product. The majority of my experience has been partnering with entertainment, sports, gaming, tech, and lifestyle brands to launch, grow, or evolve their businesses.  

Global design agencies Attik and MetaDesign were where I spent half of my career as a designer and creative leader. Both agencies allowed me to work in multiple countries and build and lead creative teams to solve client challenges. After my agency experience, I moved in-house to be Group Creative Director at Electronic Arts. There I oversaw the marketing design teams for all of EA Sports and lead the visual identity and subsequent launch of Apex Legends. 

After 7 years at EA I left to be Director of Brand Design at 1047 Games. At the small, but mighty, studio I lead the brand and design evolution of the Splitgate IP and its follow-up game currently in development. 

Partners and Clients: 1047 Games, Adobe, adidas, AT&T, Coca-Cola, DirecTV, Electronic Arts, Ford, Fox Sports, Imax, IGN, Kia Motors, Lexus, Lucas Arts, LG, Lotte, MTV, McAfee, Medtronic, NFL, Nike, PCH Int'l, Samsung, Sapporo, Scion, Smith Barney, Sprint, Sunpower, Toyota, Ubisoft, UCSF, Virgin Mobile

Skills & Interests: Strategic Identity & Brand Development / Marketing / Art Direction and Visual Narratives / Gaming / Design Strategy / Photoshoot and Video Direction / In-Product Design / Event Design / UI Design / Digital Marketing / Print & Editorial Design / Packaging Design / Painting & Screenprinting

name: Xian Li
headline: Design Manager at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
I'm currently a design manager at Riot R&D. I have a Masters focusing in Game Design from the Entertainment Technology Center at Carnegie Mellon University and a Bachelors in Software Engineering. I consider myself a design generalist as my professional experiences span across a few different genres, platforms and areas of ownerships.

I'm a social gamer and love games that creates deep and meaningful social interactions. I'm passionate about providing design mentorship, career guidence and frameworks and phylosophies that help designers grow.

name: Alex Wheeler
headline: Senior Manager - UX @ Riot Games
creator: FALSE
school_1: Stanford Graduate School of Business Executive Education
bio:
Hi! I'm Alex.

I'm a Principal UX Designer at Riot Games working to create awesome experiences for gamers around the world. I'm a lifelong gamer with a passion for the game industry and have always enjoyed deconstructing my favorite experiences and seeing how I could tweek them. 

If you *love* games and design, Riot is always looking for talented, awesome people. Feel free to reach out with questions or just to chat about games.

name: Ed Baraf
headline: Director, Operations at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio: Passionate product leader with over 20 years of expertise building teams and delivering engaging products. Expert in understanding the capabilities of technology and platforms, rapidly building an engaging customer experience, and operating it live with ongoing performance analysis. Specializes in F2P, P2W, mobile, and emergent AR/VR technologies, as well as hardware and physical goods manufacturing. Extensive experience with ads, social media platforms & content creation. Skillful at reconciling creative goals, business demands, and player needs. Deep love of Games.

name: Dave Felton
headline: Art Director @ Riot Games | Art Direction, Art Managment, Visual Design, UI, Motion Graphics
creator: FALSE
bio:
With 20 years of experience in interactive design, I am a passionate and versatile Art Lead at Riot Games, where I lead a team of talented visual designers and motion graphics artists on Teamfight Tactics, the world's #1 strategy game based in the League of Legends universe.

My core competencies include art direction, user interface / motion graphics design, and development in a variety of industry standard and proprietary game engines. In my time as a freelancer, I often collaborated with brands, design studios, and artists to create engaging and immersive experiences that delight and inspire. My mission is to leverage my skills and expertise to deliver memorable, high-quality, and player-friendly experiences.

name: Ivy Ngo
headline: Senior Software Engineer (Frontend/Gameplay, TFT)
creator: FALSE
bio:
Currently a Software Engineer II at Riot Games, working in the R&D department on an unannounced project. Metagame and UX. 

Previously a Senior Software Engineer II on the Figment app at Lumos Labs. Launched Figment internationally in June 2019 and in the US in Nov 2020. Originally hired as a Senior Software Engineer / Game Designer in August 2017 to work on Lumosity games. Led a massive porting initiative from Flash to Unity.

Worked for robotics startup Anki from October 2015 to October 2017, specializing in UI and gameplay features for the Cozmo robot. Launched Cozmo in 2016 and sold out for the holiday season. Was also an engineer at Zynga on an unannounced mobile title and ChefVille.

---- 

Graduated May 2013 with a B.S. in Game Design and Development. Experienced in working in a team dynamic. Knowledgeable in both OOP and game design.

Expert: Unity3D, C#, Mobile Development, Gameplay, UI, Agile, Scrum, JIRA, GitHub
Fluent: Unreal, C++, PC Development, Perforce, Game Design, Illustration
Familiar: Cg, Animation

Links:
http://ivyngo.com/
https://www.lumosity.com/en/figment/
https://anki.com/en-us/cozmo

name: Jami Lukins
headline: Principal UX Design Lead
creator: FALSE
bio:
My true passion lies in creating fulfilling and entertaining experiences for people. Whether it's a video game, a design process, or a college class, what truly matters to me is the impact these experiences have on the people they touch.

My journey began as an animator, but it was my fascination with UI art that sparked a love for UX design. This passion propelled me to the role of a Principal Design Lead, where I use my unique skill set to foster high-performing teams and steer projects toward innovative creative directions.

Over the past few years, I have enjoyed the challenge of creating new intellectual property. My background in user experience has been invaluable for understanding and defining our audience. My art skills have been useful for quickly communicating ideas, and my general design skills have allowed me to contribute to a wide range of design areas.

name: Albert Robles
headline: Principal Game Producer on Valorant @Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
Lead Designer (Microsoft Game Studios/ Platform Next) March 2009 - March 2013
 - Worked with incubation teams to develop technology and experiences around Kinect
 - Worked on developing in game content for Kinect pack-in title including content generation, mini-game ideation, and game systems
 - Worked with various outsource companies to develop 2nd party products and experiences
 - Managed and supervised a design team; this includes contract LDs and fulltime designers
 - Built and prototyped on various technology and platforms; both game and non-game experiences 

Senior Level Designer (Paradigm Entertainment) May 2005 - November 2008
 - Worked with design team to ideate and document in-game content
 - Worked with design leads and directors to iterate on game content using design process 
 - Built and developed grey box terrain and assets, taking to final quality through production
 - Event and AI scripting for in-game moments and gameplay 
 - Collaborated with devs, artists, and producers to deliver content and systems on time
 - Develop prototypes and proof of concept level designs in various game engines

Game Tester (Midways Games West) 2002-2003
 - Game Tester for console games
 - Write up detailed bug reports, general game testing

Specialties: Level design implementation using various software tools, scripting, strong communication skills with other departments, paper designs, strong problem solving skills, and the ability to work as a team player within a production team

name: Josh Robertson
headline: Director, Game Production Valorant
creator: FALSE
bio:
I believe that managers are the coaches and leaders of the office environment. They make project goals their own and use their skills and expertise to inspire a sense of shared purpose within the team. As a manager, I establish a shared vision by communicating clearly where we’re going and how we’re getting there. I empower the team to move quickly and efficiently while reducing the need to wait on artificial dependencies. While the team works, I do robust tracking and data gathering to help the team understand our progress on the set goals.

I’m always ready for new challenges and love the responsibility of working with a team to get results. I work extremely well under pressure while still being very comfortable with the change and complexity of dynamic environments. I can easily shift between the "big picture" and the small-but-crucial details, knowing when to concentrate on each, but using both to inform the other.

name: Kris Orpilla
headline: VFX Manager at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
3D Generalist / VFX Artist specializing in Realtime Asset creation and  VIsual Effects for the Gaming and VR/AR industry.

Currently working at Riot Games as the Lead VFX artist for 2XKO

Previously worked at Doublefine Productions as a Senior VFX artist on Psychonauts 2.

Previously worked as the Senior VFX artist for Wavedash Games.  Was in charge of general technical visual development tasks from effect prototyping tools, effect pipeline design, shaders, lighting, combat effects, and environment effects.

Worked at Waystone Games as the VFX Lead for "Dawngate"​. While Leading the VFX team, I oversaw all the game engine specific effects from environment, spells, item buffs, moment to moment abilities game play, and post game effects sequences.

Previously filled a duel role as the Character Lead and VFX Artist on an unannounced Project Under the EA Play4Free division. Was responsible for Pre-Production, Pipeline Workflow, and Outsource Management for all Character Modeling Development needs for my team. My VFX tasks included authoring VFX using proprietary tools used at EA Visceral. 

I'm always proactive in communicating with my team. One day I can be found working with the Art Director for realizing the aesthetic goals of VFX/Characters in the Game. Another day I'll be working with the Technical Director to conceive proprietary tools for outsourcing or rigging needs. While the next day I will be talking to the Lead engineer about particle shaders, polygon budgets, and input mechanics.

As a VFX artist @ EA I have previously shipped 6 Titles for the PC using an internal proprietary scripting environment. 

Other previous responsibilities have ranged from Conceptual Art for entire character suite for one Shipped Title. Texturing and Modeling of Ingame Character Assets. Authoring documents of Pipeline "Workflow"​ for junior Hires. The management of Character Outsourcing on a project.

name: Cesar Montero.
headline: Technical Art Director of League of Legends (ex TikTok / Dreamworks)
creator: FALSE
current_position: Director, Technical Art - League of Legends
bio:
My passion is programming and making code that brings pixels to life. Before being an engineer, I worked for many years as an artist. As a result, I can understand more broadly any graphic endeavor. I specialize in real-time graphics, and adapt to any team and technology to solve client needs. 

I believe in people and encourage others to push the limits of what they can achieve. There is no better feeling in knowing you helped someone attain their goals. Everything is possible with a good team and enough grit, discipline, and dedication.

Hard Skills:
* Unreal Engine 4: layout, lighting, shaders, materials.
* Programming GLSL shaders for mobile devices.
* Lighting & Rendering
* Texturing & Shading
* Hard Surface Modeling
* Compositing
* Pipeline & Workflow Development
* Marketing, technology-focused
* Business Development, small business
* Artist Management and Mentorship
* Outsource Management
* Unity (beginner)

Software Skills:
Unreal Engine, Unity, Maya, Modo, Lightwave, MARI, Substance Painter/Designer, Photoshop, After Effects, Nuke, Fusion, Illustrator, Crank Studio, Arnold, Redshift, JIRA, Excel

Languages:
* GLSL, C++, LUA, Python, JavaScript
* English, Spanish, French, learning Mandarin. 

Cesar Montero
cesardevelops@gmail.com

name: Yifu Qiao
headline: Strategist | PMP
creator: FALSE
school_2: The Art Institute of California-Los Angeles
bio:
Strength

Yifu is a great communicator with excellent people relationship skills and leadership quality. With his 10 years of working experience in tech industry, strong math skills and excellent financial analysis skills, he is ready to contribute to any team.

Story

Yifu's most recent achievement in his career is launching Lenovo Mirage AR Headset at the end of 2017. He played a critical role in the whole process, from prototyping to product delivery, producing the best-selling commercial-grade augmented reality headset with over 500,000 units sold, resulting in over $100 million in revenue. He was a leading effort in collaboration with Lenovo and Disney teams in both software and hardware development throughout the process.

Vision
Yifu sees himself as a problem solver for any organization with his background, connections and industry knowledge.

Contacts:
Email: yifugo@gmail.com
Cell: 805-501-2425

name: Ray Ocampo
headline: Senior UX / UX Leader @ Riot Games | ex-Blizzard Entertainment / ex-EA
creator: FALSE
bio:
Hello! I'm an experienced designer and pro dungeon master who brings a suite of multidisciplinary skills to the team.

TLDR: I'm a guy who loves video games and enjoys the craft.

UX and UI is where I excel. I greatly enjoy being the liaison between art, design, engineering, all in the effort to create fun and intuitive functionality through meaningful gaming experiences. I believe in having strong user empathy and passion for the user to deliver balanced and relevant products to people all over the world.

I love learning and challenging myself with new and unique projects.

Specialties:
• Applying Human/Player-centric Design
• Rapid Prototyping
• Strong Drawing and Painting abilities
• Superior eye for color, value, composition, staging and detail
• Ability to carry an idea from concept to finished
• Contribute original visual design ideas throughout pre-production and production
• Knowledge of usability best-practices for mobile and PC games and products
• Creating clear and easy to follow style guides
• Developing concept diagrams, wireframes, visual mockups, and prototypes
• Designing the UI architecture, interface, and interaction flow for mobile applications
• Directing the visual design
• Presenting design work to UX team members, stakeholders, and project teammates for review and feedback

I'm a fun team member with ability to work effectively with all levels in the organization including people with different styles and backgrounds.

bio: With a focus on Gameplay Programming, I have been working on AAA games for over 6 years. name: Scott H. W. Snyder
headline: Sr. Manager of UX Design on VALORANT
creator: FALSE
bio:
I'm an experience designer, gamer, musician, and cat lover based in the Seattle, WA area.

After nearly a decade designing products and interfaces at Microsoft and another 2 years managing a design team at Expedia, I’m now living the dream and working on my favorite game of all time, VALORANT, with the brilliant devs at Riot Games.

name: Nicolas Lamanna
headline: Staff Systems Engineer at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
Veteran game developer and passionate about games as a meaningful pursuit.

Went from being a software engineer, to form a few start-ups in Argentina and create the first MMORPG in 3D for that region.

Currently in Riot games, helping operate and manage the rCluster platform that powers Valorant, Legends of Runeterra, League of Legends and future games. Serving over 180 millions of players around the planet.

Not currently entertaining transfers but happy to connect, who knows what the future holds.

name: Daniel Kim
headline: Sound Designer at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
If you're curious how I got my current job at Riot, please take a look at this blog post! 
https://danielkimaudio.com/blog/2019/11/18/how-i-got-my-job

I am a highly passionate sound designer currently working at Riot Games as a Sound Designer on League of Legends, creating immersive and satisfying sounding skins, champions, and events!

Since I started, I worked on game audio for a lot of student, indie and game jam projects. From these experiences, I cultivated a well-rounded toolset of abilities regarding advanced sound editing and production, gear setup, audio implementation, and technical support.

If you are looking to connect, you can reach out to me here or on X, (@RiotKDan), and I’ll try to respond to you as soon as I can.

name: Hai Phan
headline: Art Outsource Director at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
school_1: Savannah College of Art and Design
bio:
Well over a decade of professional 3d modeling and design experience for video game art. Experienced with supporting and leading teams. Shipped AAA game titles:

Overwatch (+ live content)
Rift: Storm Legion
Rift (live content)
Guild Wars 2
Guild Wars: Eye of the North
Guild Wars: Nightfall 

I strive to create the most memorable and versatile game models possible, and I always work towards the betterment of the game project.  My greatest strength is versatility, and I have been able to excel in all facets of game art including 2d concept painting, 3d modeling (both low poly/real-time and high resolution sculpting), hand painted textures, and even some rigging and animation.  

It is my experience in all of these areas that allows me to make informed decisions and help best integrate character art into the rest of the game art production pipeline.

name: Paulo Vitor Damo da Rosa
location: Porto Alegre, Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil
headline:
Senior Game Designer with 20 years of experience in professional gaming.
Currently working for Legends of Runeterra at Riot Games.
2020 MTG World Champion.
creator: FALSE
bio:
Senior Game Designer for Legends of Runeterra.

Professional Magic: the Gathering player and writer. Member of the MTG Hall of Fame and the #1 money-earner in the history of all TCGs. 2020-2021 MTG World Champion and four-times National Champion. 

I've been creating content for Magic: the Gathering for over 20 years. In this time, I've written over 1000 strategy articles for various international websites, and I've also done videos, streams, podcasts and coverage of high-level events. 

In 2018 I started my first job as a game designer, and I worked on the Elder Scrolls TCG for a little over a year as design and developer of the game - my goal was to create the cards and mechanics to make the game as enjoyable as possible for the players. After that, I worked at Interpop as a Game Designer for the Emergents TCG, where I was responsible for both design and development of the card file and the game rules. Currently I work as a designer for the Legends of Runeterra card game, where I work with a multidisciplinary team to design and implement new champions, items, abilities and enemies.

I'm a gamer through and through, and I've been involved with a variety of other games as well. I've played Bridge competitively at the international level, and I've also done commentary for Hearthstone and Storybook Brawl events. On top of that, I've spent countless hours in games like Baldur's Gate 2, Diablo 2 and 3 , Heroes 3 and TFT.

name: Tammy Nicholls
headline: Narrative Manager at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
I am an experienced creative manager with a track record of success in media, consumer products, publishing and video games. I have a background in design and I am passionate about helping creatives produce their best work while retaining a commercial edge. 

I am responsible for the Licensing Creative Studio and the creative aspects of all of Games Workshop’s licensed products, including our largest licensed franchises. I lead the narrative and creative development across these franchises, and the company's exciting new licensed transmedia, film and television projects. These include products like Total War: WARHAMMER III, Space Marine 2, the Marvel Warhammer comics.

Prior to joining the Games Workshop Licensing department, I was the Graphic Design Lead on many projects including Games Workshop’s 2014 tentpole release (7th edition 40K).

The sustainable work systems and continuous improvement strategies I've implemented reflect my dedication to not just meeting but exceeding the standards of today's dynamic gaming landscape.

name: Andrea Bellucci
headline: Music Composer for movies and video games
creator: TRUE
bio:
With over ten years of experience as a composer and producer for films, tv shows and games, I am a passionate musician with huge experience and innovative taste.

Currently collaborating with major and indie productions worldwide, I have contributed to world-phenomenon projects, including Riot Games' "League of Legends," Hi-Rez's "Smite," and "Paladins."

Recent works include Skydance, Riot Games, Hi-Rez, Amazon Studios, Sky, Sony Publishing, Hollywood Scoring and Lionsgate, as well as music placements on Fox Network, National Geographic, CBS, and more.

Drawing from a diverse range of genres and moods, I strive to create immersive musical experiences that bring characters and worlds to life. Whether it's an epic orchestral score, an atmospheric electronic soundscape, or a memorable and catchy theme, I aim to deliver music that deeply resonates with audiences.

More on www.andreabellucci.com
