name: Daniel Leaver
headline: Design Initiative Lead at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
Design Initiative Lead on the "PIE" initiative (character skins, battlepass events, personalization and customization systems) on League of Legends at Riot Games. Senior Design Manager for all Game and UX Designers within the PIE initiative. 

Formerly on the League of Legends 'Summoner's Rift' annual update (pre-season) team. 

Professional videogame designer since 2006. Strong understanding of all aspects of game/level/combat design, competitive multiplayer balance, player progression systems and player customization/expression feature development. Multi-year experience in production/scheduling and multi-discipline team management. Gameplay clarity, "game-feel" and 'actually shipping the game' are my specialties.

Founder, designer, producer and team leader at indie studio Dreadbit Ltd; creators of steampunk puzzle combat game 'Ironcast' and acrobatic shooter, 'Seraph'. 

Previously a senior designer for Media Molecule, helping to ship the multi-award-winning user-generated-content (UGC) titles 'LittleBIGPlanet' 1 and 2, 'Tearaway', 'Tearaway: Unfolded' and 'Dreams'.

name: Ananda Gupta
headline: Design Director at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
Game designer with 21 years'​ industry experience and 9 shipped titles in the RTS, turn-based strategy, MMO, and auto-battler genres, most recently "League of Legends: Teamfight Tactics". Winner of the 2005 James Dunnigan Award in game design.

Co-designer of Twilight Struggle (GMT Games), a board game about the Cold War; it has won six awards and held the #1 spot on Boardgamegeek.com for five years, and in 2024 it was inducted into the GAMA Hall of Fame. The digital version (iOS + Android) won the 2016 Golden Geek awards for Best Boardgame App and Best Mobile Game. Imperial Struggle, the spiritual successor to Twilight Struggle, won the Golden Geek award for Best Wargame of 2020.

Specialties: Systems & gameplay analysis & design; creative writing for games; development team management.

name: Damion Healy
headline: Art direction
creator: FALSE
bio:
I'm a seasoned game developer with 27 years of experience. I'm dedicated to driving quality and excellence while fostering a collaborative working environment. I'm passionate about my work and strive for professionalism and innovation. 

I am focused on balancing a creative vision with practical considerations and can navigate complex challenges with finesse and diplomacy. I believe that good communication and a little process are sometimes all it takes to take something good and make it great. 

During my career, I have built departments, created and implemented processes, and crafted teams from scratch. However, the majority of my work has been focused on art direction for triple-A titles while contributing to game design and overall creative direction. I consider myself a gamer and a video game creator who occupies the intersection of art and design.

Throughout my career, I have had the privilege of working across a wide range of disciplines in the artistic and design domains of game development. These experiences have granted me valuable insights into both the expectations I hold for my teams, what they need from me, and also the needs of the projects.

name: Terra Ray
headline: Game Producer II, Summoner's Rift Team
creator: FALSE
current_position: Game Producer II - Summoner's Rift Team
bio:
First and foremost my passion is games and the people who work on them.  Playing games was a huge part of my life as a child and I found my passion in creating them as an adult.  I live out my dream every day by working with the many amazing and talented people in the gaming industry and continuing to make amazing customer-focused games that deliver unique and exciting experiences to their players.

As a Producer my goals are to help my team get the most out of the tools in their belt, and if none of those are working investigate new ones! I'm a big believer that if anyone at the organization sees a problem and has the motivation, they should have the ability to drive forward a new process or new solution to fix the problem that they see.

Certified Scrum Master, proficient in agile methodologies, Scrum team leadership, release planning, roadmap formation, company culture development, technical team expertise, and more! Six years of industry experience, three major shipped titles, indie experience, and a background in design and engineering.

name: Lisa Kim Thorn
headline: I'm a creative with a brain for politics who believes fun belongs to us all.
creator: TRUE
current_position: Sr. Principal Visual Designer / Art Director
school_1: The Heller School for Social Policy and Management at Brandeis University
bio: Returning to the games and technology space after completing a master's degree in public policy, I hope to combine my research with my experience as a designer and organizational leader to expand the gaming community through inclusive design. When the medium strongly dictates who gets to see themselves as a player, developer, or creator, the community loses valuable moments of fun. I think everyone should be able to have fun.

name: David Kury
headline: Senior Producer at Riot Games
creator: TRUE
bio:
I love great story telling and compelling games! My goal is to create amazing interactive experiences, building upon my diverse experience (game production and animation) and doing everything to support the vision of the director in making an enriching and compelling game experience. I enjoy problem solving  the bumps that every project hits along the way in development.

While I've been working in games for almost 20 years, I've been fortunate over the past 10 years to be involved in virtual production development on projects at Lucasfilm (SW1313) and Crystal Dynamics (Tomb Raider and Avengers). Departments and areas that I've produced: level development, narrative, casting, VO recording, cinematics (storyboarding, PCAP shoots, post-production), facial development, player avatar, level design (single player and co-op), animation, motion capture shoots, character development, outsourcing content/tools, concept art, environment art, vfx, tools and pipelines, and rendering.

name: Patrick Ghiocel
headline: Senior Software Engineer / Tech Lead
creator: FALSE
bio: I have been a software engineer in the game industry since 2003. While I have filled a variety of roles such as level designer and team lead, I've specialized in engine and 3d render development, primarily on the PC. My work as an engine/renderer engineer has developed an interest in solving content pipelines problems for artists and designers. In my time in the game industry, I have worked on other aspects of game development from client gameplay and server code to even using other programming languages such as C#, Python, Ruby and SQL. I'm used to small organizations, tight schedules, flexible assignments, and working in a team environment.

name: Frankie Galvez
headline: Freelance sound designer, Audio Editor, Audio Mixer,  Audio Recordist and Audio producer.
creator: FALSE
bio:
🎧 Freelance Audio Engineer | Sound Wizard 🎵

Passionate about bringing sonic excellence to every project, I am a versatile and dedicated freelance audio engineer with a proven track record in delivering top-notch sound experiences. From music production to podcast editing, I specialize in crafting immersive audio that captivates audiences and elevates the overall quality of content.

Music Production: Whether you're an aspiring artist or an established band, I have the technical prowess and creative flair to bring your musical vision to life. From recording and mixing to mastering, I ensure that your sound is polished and professional.

Podcast Editing: As a skilled podcast audio engineer, I understand the importance of clear communication and engaging content. I enhance the quality of your podcast through meticulous editing, noise reduction, and seamless integration of music and sound effects.

Live Sound: Experienced in providing impeccable sound reinforcement for live events, I thrive in dynamic environments. From concerts and conferences to workshops, I ensure that the audience experiences crystal-clear audio that enhances the overall event atmosphere.

🛠️ Technical Skills:

Pro Tools, Ableton Live, Logic Pro X
Audio Editing and Mixing
Foley and Sound Design
Field Recording and Soundscaping
Studio and Live Sound Reinforcement

Let's collaborate and turn your auditory dreams into reality! 🎙️✨ #AudioEngineering #Freelancer #SoundDesign #MusicProduction #PodcastEditing

name: Vance Wu
headline: Senior Technical Artist at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
school_2: Art Institute of California - San Francisco
bio:
I have been a Technical Artist and 3D Artist in the mobile and AAA game industry since 2009 with shipped titles and products on platforms ranging from home consoles and mobile devices to the web and PCs. I am currently at Riot Games, helping to create the next generation of AAA experiences.

1 Tech Crunch Crunchie Award:
"CityVille" - Best Time Sink (2010)

1 Academy of Interactive Arts & Sciences Award
"CityVille" - Social Networking Game of the Year (2010)

Skills:
• Proficiency in: Unity • C# • Python • MEL • Javascript • HTML/CSS • Perforce • Git • Maya • 3ds Max • Photoshop • ZBrush • Unreal • Illustrator • After Effects
• Tools development and shader authoring
• Maintaining and evolving scalable content creation pipelines
• 3D hard surface and organic art creation for characters and environments, modeling, UV mapping, texturing, rigging, lighting, rendering/baking, and animation
• Internal/outsource art management, scheduling and creating comprehensive art style guides

Shipped Titles:
• Living Gallery - Augmented Reality Experience for the Blizzard Museum (iOS) - 2017
• Marvel Avengers Academy (iOS, Android) - 2016
• The Sims 4 (PC, Mac) - 2014
• VoltAir (Android) - 2014
• Battlestone (iOS, Android) - 2013
• Germ Smash (iOS, Android) - 2013
• CityVille (Web, iOS) - 2010
• YoVille (Web) - 2009
• PlayStation Home (PS3) - 2009

Activities:
• 2013: Independently released Germ Smash, a mobile game on the App Store for iOS devices
• 2012: Won 1st place in Zynga studio hackathon for best game pitch: “Solar Blast”
• 2007 - 2011: Game Developer’s Conference (GDC) volunteer Conference Associate

name: Caitlin Gillman
headline: Associate Content Producer at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
My name is Caitlin Gillman and I am a 30 year-old Los Angeles native currently working in the gaming / animation industry. 

I graduated from Syracuse University, College of Visual and Performing Arts in 2016 with a BFA in Computer Art & Animation and a minor in Marketing at the Whitman School of Management.  

Growing up, I always knew I would be in the animation / gaming industry. As a kid, I would sit down in front of my favorite cartoons and draw whatever came on screen. I would often create my own characters for my favorite stories as well as come up with stories of my own (often acting them out with the action figures and Barbie dolls I collected). I took traditional / foundation art, photography, and graphic design classes at various studios / schools as a kid and young adult. I also played a ton of video games.

As I got older, I realized that living the life of an artist wasn’t exactly what I wanted to do for a living, but I knew that I wanted to still be a part of the animation industry. Now, I am pursuing the path of the business side of the industry. My dream is to become an executive that is able to use my knowledge of technology and art to make effective business decisions that help grow whatever company I am a part of. 

I have also always been a huge nerd — I grew up going to Comic Con every year with my family, I basically learned how to read through comics and  manga, and spent many afternoons playing video games on whatever console was hot that year. I definitely found my passion early on in life and  have been lucky enough to pursue it ever since. 

When I’m not at work, I like to spend time with my friends and family, play video games, go to concerts and drag shows, watch anime and other shows, play softball on my co-ed team, go to the gym, watch sports and eSports, organize big group meet-ups for various networking organizations I run, and just try to make sense of being an adult.

I hope to continue my career in this industry and pursue my passion further.

name: Richard Hough
headline: Sr. Design Director for R&D at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
I believe that the best approach to creating a fun game is to treat design akin to tackling a scientific or engineering problem. Designs should be iterated on regularly, theories should be tested, and through deliberate choices it's possible to create robust and malleable frameworks with which players can engage. Building fun is a difficult task, and one that can be best completed by collaborating with individuals from every discipline towards a single, aligned vision.

Specialties: mechanics and system design, product management, team leadership.

name: Brian Morrisroe
headline: Sr. Director of Operations (R&D) at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
I have 20 years of experience building high performance teams and delivering successful, innovative products in both startup and turn-around environments, with the past 10 years in executive management roles for small and mid-size organizations.

Developing highly creative, disciplined yet innovative teams capable of delivering against challenging goals is what drives me professionally.  This passion led me to start Booyah, a company focused on location based mobile gaming.  As Co-Founder and Chief Creative Officer, later promoted to CEO, my areas of responsibility included fund raising, new product development, business operations and market strategy.

Having grown from artistic to executive management roles, I have developed a unique skillset blending creativity with business understanding.  My transition from artist to leader began during the 6 years spent with Blizzard Entertainment.  As Lead for World of Warcraft and Art Director for Diablo III, I encouraged the team to push past conventional boundaries to create the visual style and future art direction for some of the most successful gaming franchises in the industry.

Specialties:  corporate strategy, product development, global operations, team building, and general management

name: Sarah Joynt Borger MBA, MFA, p.g.a, AEA
headline: Senior Creative Strategist | Expert in Global Media, Events, and Cross-Functional Leadership| Ex-Blizzard, EA, NBCUniversal
creator: TRUE
current_position: Head of Media House, EMEA (Director, Content Services)
bio:
Dynamic media and events leader with 15+ years in creative operations and strategic content production. Proven success in driving cross-functional teams to deliver large-scale, innovative events and campaigns that boost engagement and operational efficiency. Expertise in managing multi-million-dollar budgets, optimizing creative workflows, and leveraging digital media for brand impact.

Currently, I lead a global team across 27 countries, implementing media strategies that improved operational efficiency by 34% and audience engagement by 15%. Known for setting long-term strategic goals that drive business growth and brand engagement through emerging technologies and integrated content solutions.

Core Strengths:
* Strategic Leadership: Achieved a 30% rise in audience engagement and 20% operational improvement.
* Event Production & Innovation: Expert in live, virtual, and hybrid events, from concept to execution.
* Financial Management: Skilled in P&L oversight, with a track record of reducing costs by 21% while generating new revenue streams.

name: Chris Lockwood
headline: Gameplay Engineer at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
Gameplay engineer with experience working on gameplay logic, networking, UI, 3D animation and tools development. I thrive in challenging environments that demand deep understandings of complex systems and tight cross-discipline collaboration. I've worked full-stack on games, from normalizing tables in MySQL to building out UI for that data client side.

      Strong: Unity3D, Git, Perforce, C#, OOP, Entity-Component-Systems, Networking, 3D Math
      Experienced: C++, MySQL, MySQL Workbench Blender, Go, Docker, JavaScript, Lua

name: Matthew Demaray
headline: Associate Art Director at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
current_position: Associate Art Director at Riot Games
school_1: School of the Art Institute of Chicago
bio:
Over the years, I've been involved in a mix of projects where I've worn different hats. From running my own post-effects business to being an art director in advertising and freelancing, I've gathered a range of professional experiences. In 2006, I made the leap into the gaming industry full time, and since then, I've been part of the teams delivering numerous AAA titles.

In the gaming world, I've worked on everything from FPS to turn-based strategy games, covering platforms like PC, Xbox Series X, Xbox One, PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox 360, and PlayStation 3. Beyond gaming, I've dabbled in creating kiosks, crafting motion graphics for TV, visualizing products, and building interactive content for the Internet.

I pride myself on being adaptable to change and thriving in different work environments. Whether taking the lead or providing support, I'm comfortable working independently or collaborating with others. My experience on both ends of outsourcing has equipped me with the skills to tackle large projects in tight timeframes. Building strong and fruitful relationships with clients is something I've excelled at, showcasing my ability to engage professionally at every level.

name: Paul Virgin
headline: Game Producer II - Age Ratings at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
- Game Development Production Support: Aided with the creation and maintenance of the Legal clearance pipeline, with a focus on upcoming MTX releases.
- Also utilized Perforce to check-in script changes to item descriptions, rarity, etc. Furthermore, utilized Perforce for build creation to check the veracity of said changes.

-Onsite Event Support and Management: work with various stakeholders in the aim of successful execution of live events from a technical standpoint. This includes build management and transfer, support for Esports streams and demonstrations, QA against special event builds, and other production duties as they arise. 

-Production Experience: Embedded with the Call of Duty production team, and assisted with various needs as they arose, including submission documentation creation, and QA bug review; primary responsibilities during this time was managing all capture asset requests for the team - includes game capture, editing, and input when requested. These assets were used in both for internal review, as well as public facing assets used to aid in the marketing of the title.

-Quality Assurance Experience: Performed a variety of Quality Assurance related duties, including team leader experience. This includes black box game testing, bug write-up and reporting, and monitoring development sweeps. Team leader experience includes project management and general versatility across a variety of platforms. 

-Statistical Analysis: Managed small teams in guided statistical analysis, with the aim of improving the quality of life of the Call of Duty ELITE community. This included providing accurate and concise documentation of the work performed.

-Design and Marketing Experience: Supervised / executed the creation of numerous print advertisements, in addition to being versed in various forms of social media and web marketing.

-Retail: Heavily versed in ground level sales, understanding what customers are looking for, and how to get it directly into their hands. This ensures customer loyalty and happiness, which in turn drives future sales forward.

- Works hard to be awesome at everything.

name: Miranda Sim
headline: Creative Art Director at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
As a Creative Art Director in the gaming industry, I am driven by a strong passion for my work. I have a deep love for learning and exploring various art forms, constantly challenging myself to improve my skills and knowledge throughout my career. Interacting with individuals from diverse fields has been a constant source of inspiration and ideas that I eagerly apply to my work.

With a keen eye and a heightened sense of aesthetics, I strive to create visually captivating experiences that immerse players. I firmly believe that the fusion of creativity, technical expertise, and storytelling is crucial in crafting unforgettable and impactful games.

Throughout my career, I have been fortunate to contribute to numerous projects, honing my leadership skills while guiding talented artists and designers to achieve a unified artistic vision. I thrive in environments that foster innovation and imagination, consistently pushing boundaries to deliver exceptional results.

Fueled by my passion for creating extraordinary gaming experiences, I continually strive to stay at the forefront of emerging industry trends and technologies. I am dedicated to fostering a collaborative and supportive environment that nurtures creativity and encourages growth.

In summary, I am an enthusiastic Creative Art Director in the gaming industry. Approaching each project with curiosity, my goal is to create unique and captivating experiences that deeply resonate with players.

name: Dongwook Kim
headline: VFX Artist ll at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
I'm an experienced VFX Artist specializing in stylized VFX. Proficient with Unreal Engine, and adaptable to all other engines and tools. I love making awesome effects in UE4 that makes games feel grounded and alive. When I met obstacles, I never quit until I break through them.

When I'm not working, I usually join discord with my game buddies and play video games together.

name: Julio Diaz
headline: Head of Art - Global Marketing Creative
creator: FALSE
current_position: Head of Art - Global Marketing Creative
bio:
Art Director with a strong professional career in reputable brands, mostly within the entertainment sector. Expertise in implementing individual projects from start to finish, as well as large-scale projects, managing multi-disciplinary art teams.

I enjoy my work, and I firmly believe in teamwork and proper planning. I am an excellent motivator, enthusiastic, proactive, responsible, resilient.

Specialties: Creative direction, branding and identity, merchandising, editorial design, illustration, product development.

bio:
Open to freelance or full-time for the right team: game writer, narrative writer, narrative designer

Hey! I'm a game writer with a background in creative and brand marketing for AAA and indie games. Always looking to create meaningful player experiences through character and environmental storytelling. Let's team up! 

Games and platforms I’ve worked on: Teamfight Tactics, Pokémon GO, Roblox, League of Legends, Sonic the Hedgehog, Dying Light, Words With Friends, and more

name: Yuzun K.
headline: Executive Producer, Film & TV for Riot Entertainment
creator: FALSE
current_position: Executive Producer / Head of Story, Film & TV for Riot Entertainment
bio:
Creative producer & executive with 13+ years experience in games, film & TV. Working directly with the founders of Riot Games, I co-founded the Film & TV initiative at Riot Games, setting and leading the creative and strategic vision of Film & TV projects at Riot Games (the developer and publisher of LEAGUE OF LEGENDS, VALORANT, and TFT).

---

With a solid foundation in game, film and TV development, my journey at Riot Games has been marked by a distinctive blend of narrative innovation, creative excellence and strategic leadership. At the helm of Riot Entertainment's Film & TV division, my focus is on crafting compelling and authentic stories that resonate with a global audience and bridge the dynamic worlds of gaming and media.

My tenure as Co-Head of Film & TV was instrumental in establishing a robust development pipeline and assembling a creative team that shares a commitment to excellence and a passion for storytelling. Collaboratively, we've charted a content strategy that leverages our gaming heritage to create immersive experiences, setting new benchmarks for entertainment in the digital age.

name: Jessica Noordzij
headline: Senior Game Production Coordinator on League of Legends at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
current_position: Senior Game Production Coordinator on League of Legends
bio:
I recently joined the amazing Riot Games family and am loving my position as Senior Game Production Coordinator. In my current role, I get to flex my skills at configuring the in-client Event Shop and Store and assist with art direction and production of the store and loot assets. Having over 10 years of experience working as a Web Developer building and maintaining web platforms for B2B and B2C companies in the education and ecommerce sectors have helped me to get to where I am today. I love solving tough problems, streamlining workflows, and working with team members and clients to drive results that surprise and delight.

I'm a huge fan of fantasy and video games and I absolutely adore modding video games, playing D&D with friends, and nerding out over new RPGs!

name: Lee Bledsoe
headline: Manager Visual Effects @ Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
Objective:
Finding challenging and innovative opportunities that further my development as an expert artist & creator in the interactive digital entertainment field.

Overview:
To say that I'm passionate about the evolving landscape of interactive digital entertainment would be an understatement. I have dedicated myself to interactive digital entertainment, VR production, immersive storytelling and the use of the latest cutting-edge technology where I have established and proven myself as an award-winning creator with deep technical skills.

Additionally, I have over 15 years of experience working on AAA video games as an animator and VFX artist and art lead. All which have resulted in my strong and very unique foundation in digital entertainment. 

Specialties: Immersive Experience Design, Animation, Special Effects, Mixed Reality Capture, 360 editing, Post Production Pipeline, Industrial Design, Photography, VR, Cinematography, CG, Compositing, Editing, Color grading, Sound design, Rapid Prototyping

name: Sir H.
headline: Senior VFX Artist at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
[I am not currently looking for a job, please do not solicit me.] 

Now Senior VFX Artist at Riot Games, I graduated from my Video Games Art studies in Belgium in 2015, and directly moved to Italy in order to work as a VFX Artist for Rimlight Studios. One year later, I moved to Canada to work for Gameloft. And another year later, I started working for Riot Games.

I love listening to music, writing, playing video games and experimenting on VFXs more than anything. I am always impatient to learn new techniques and acquire new knowledge, especially in my domain of expertise. I am a fast learner, and apply my newly-discovered magical powers to my work immediately.

Oh and my main language is French.

[I am not currently looking for a job.]

name: Natanel Apfel
headline: Principal Technical VFX Artist
creator: FALSE
bio:
I am a Rendering Technical Artist and Programmer with a broad range of expertise in the Real-time VFX discipline from each end of the pipeline (dcc tools, asset creation, shaders, source code, implementation etc). I do both art and code!

I have many years of AAA experience with proficiencies in C++, HLSL/GLSL, Unreal Engine (API, Blueprint, Niagara etc), Python etc. And have worked across all platforms (Mobile, Console and PC), in Unreal Engine and proprietary engines.

name: Leo Ebrahimi
headline: Ui Designer | Ux Designer | Product Designer | Crypto Project Promoter | Project Manager
creator: FALSE
bio:
Graphic designer, experienced in creating infographics, and more. Web developer with several years of relevant
experience in the industry including programming, debugging, and wireframe creation. Proficient in blockchain
technology and managing executive token and coin projects in the areas of gamification, Defi, web 3, metaverse, nft, dApps, and more. Designing
whitepapers for Crypto Currency projects, building smart contracts on BEP20, ERC20, TRC20 platforms. Developing tokens and coins according to the

name: Kalita Saintonge
headline: Technical Product Manager at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
More commonly known as Kiki - I have a passion for making games and in particular enhancing preexisting UX and mechanics within games. In my experience it's not about how much a player can do, but how well they can learn to do it.

I develop small game projects in Unity whenever I have time and energy. Any remaining time after that is spent drawing, writing music, 3D modelling in Blender, studying Mandarin Chinese, and running D&D campaigns.

name: Amanda Pruchnicki
headline: Senior Technical Writer
creator: FALSE
school_2: University of Washington Human Centered Design & Engineering
bio:
I enjoy crafting useful information (and obsessively iterating until people actually want to use it).

My background in software documentation, business analysis, user-centered information development, and game production (while dogfooding my own docs!) have uniquely positioned me to empathize deeply with every information problem that crosses my path.

My writing process always includes putting myself in the user’s shoes as far as I can go (in the tools/processes), and trying to anticipate every need without bogging down the reader. 

As a producer in games (yes, that happened! https://www.mobygames.com/person/1036490/amanda-soyo-ahn/credits/), I built and maintained project info, ran weekly art and design reviews for multiple projects simultaneously for almost two full development cycles, with directors and leads of all disciplines within the studio, identified production bottlenecks, improved and created processes, resolved conflicts, prevented unnecessary work, mentored, and took on ownership proactively to provide utmost clarity while alleviating as much unnecessary stress and strain on the team as was within my power. I became a "hub" person and went to great lengths to give teams the best and fully vetted information the first time around and throughout a project.

A theme in my career is that in every role, I’ve created or improved processes out of a desire to help people avoid unnecessary pain. This includes impacting hundreds of little design changes in tools, features, and workflows across my work at IBM, Panda Restaurant Group, and Infinity Ward. 

I enjoy being able to walk in my user’s shoes and catering info for their specific workflows.

name: Lauren A.
headline: R&D Artist at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio: AAA lighting artist with a background in commercial photography. After earning a photography degree and working in the field for 5 years, I jumped into the world of 3D. This new frontier provided me with the opportunity to combine my two passions: lighting and immersive storytelling. I have a keen eye for dramatic lighting and a solid foundation behind the lens as a photographer. I currently do real-time cinematics and level lighting for AAA games.

name: Fortune Katherine
headline: Splash Illustrator at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
With 10 years of professional experience ranging from mobile social games to highly competitive PC games, I've worked on live service games with tight schedules and quick turn arounds to create some of the industry's best illustrations and game ready assets. I also have experience managing outsourcing studios, working within efficient feedback loops and highly collaborative environments, and working within my team to create an environment of trust and empathy.

I want to create highly expressive and emotional games and art, lets do it! :)

headline: Voice Director at Bioware
creator: FALSE
school_1: Victoria School for the Performing Arts
bio:
Josh Dean is an experienced actor and voice over director.  Originally from Canada, Josh moved to Los Angeles to pursue an acting career and within one month was cast as the lead for the improvised FOX sitcom "Free Ride."  He continued to work regularly in television and movies, most recently as recurring character Boston Arliss Crab on NBC's "Blindspot" and as the lead of the Harlequin movie "The Art of Falling in Love."

After many years as a voice over actor, Josh made the transition to directing with Bioware's "Dragon Age: Inquisition."  His long time video game fanaticism and ability to communicate with actors has combined to help build a successful career as a Voice Over Director.  He has directed for Nintendo, Sony, Eidos, Treyarch/Infinity Ward, Riot, Ubisoft and Sega among others.  Recent releases include Obsidian's "The Outer Worlds", Infinity Ward's "Call of Duty: Modern Warfare", the most recent edition of Eidos' "Hitman" and many new champions and animated shorts for Riot's "League of Legends".

name: Heather Kjolsing
headline: Operations Manager and Producer
creator: FALSE
bio:
Riot Games is a video game developer and esports tournament organizer based in Los Angeles, California. Riot Games develops and publishes League of Legends, the most played online PC game in the world. As a project manager at Riot Games, I lead teams in the successful delivery of projects, managing the scope, timing, budget and quality for a variety of initiatives. 

Achievements:

• Led "Buy It @ Riot," a transformation of Riot Games' Procure to Pay processes and systems to establish a more scalable business process and long term cost reductions
• Led the operations in the finance discipline to establishing more efficient and motivated teams to improve productivity and reduce turnover
• Led project and account-wide efforts for a variety of client accounts, including AARP,  Bank of America, Toyota, Fleming’s Steakhouse, Oakwood Worldwide, and Roy’s Restaurant
• Managed the creation of an enterprise-level CRM web application using agile development
• Shipped indie games Karateka and Karateka Classic on iOS, Android, and PlayStation Network

name: Gage B.
headline: VFX Artist II on Valorant @ Riot Games
creator: FALSE
school_1: Otis College of Art and Design
bio: Gage Burcham has had the opportunity to contribute to notable projects at Riot Games, including Legends of Runeterra and Valorant. Guided by a 'player-first' philosophy, he always aims to create experiences that resonate with players. His interest in procedural systems often leads to more streamlined game development processes. Beyond Riot, Gage has been fortunate to collaborate with respected industry names like Activision and Epic Games. With a genuine enthusiasm for learning, He is always looking to refine and improve his craft.

name: Zaineb Aljumayaat
headline: 3D Environment Artist | Prev @ Riot Games | Illustration @ RISD
creator: TRUE
bio: I am a 3D game artist specializing in stylized and painterly assets, environments, and worlds! I have experience in Blender, Maya, ZBrush, Unreal, 3D Coat, and Substance Painter. Through my refined painting skills, I can create hand-painted and PBR textures for assets along with prioritizing optimization. I also have experience managing and working with complex teams of artists and engineers, from student projects to AAA games. Through my team-based game development experiences I can work efficiently with a team to produce the best quality work!

name: Alexander R.
headline: Outsource Art Supervisor at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
I am a top-performing, multi-talented CG supervisor (and artist) with a solid track record leading creative teams to deliver excellence in design and technology. My areas of expertise include CG animation, 3D design, modeling, UV mapping, Rigging, VFX, and staff leadership.

I have extensive experience and success within the entertainment industry covering Game, 3D Animation, Film, Television,  as well as augmented and virtual reality. I utilize state-of the-art creative and technical tools and have demonstrated expertise in a variety of high-performance creative applications.

I have established a reputation for my interpersonal skills that I have found to be essential to driving consensus and leading diverse and highly-talented teams, and interfacing professionally with clients and all levels of staff.

name: Chaitanya K.
headline: Senior Software Engineer, SDK at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
Portfolio: www.ckportfolio.link

Working at Riot Games on the Riot SDK. Helping all game teams interface with Riot's back-end services.

Led the development of BYTON's prolific UI/UX prototyping and simulation platform. Built with Unity and C#, we owned BYTONs in car experience explorations, and all showcar and marketing efforts. 

Worked on 'Design Home' as a front-end Unity engineer. 'Design Home' is developed by Glu's CrowdStar team, and is a top-grossing mobile game available on iOS and Android. 
I worked on localization, game optimization, and new game features. Critically, I helped reduce the game's loading times and improved in app purchases be more reliable.

My prior work at SmartyPal, and Trendy Entertainment are discussed in my resumé.

name: Tony Corace
headline: Senior Researcher at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
Currently, I am imbedded within VALORANT's Core Game area as a Senior Researcher. I led all playtesting, validation, and anything else research for VALORANT's console release. This included extensive work on the new onboarding experience, updated console UI, gameplay validation, audience exploration, and non-verbal communication systems.    

I am also an award winning game designer, receiving the "Defy the Limits" award for innovation in the 2024 Riot Thunderdome game jam. 

Previously, I helped support many of the user research initiatives with the Age of Empires franchise while contracting with Xbox (XR&D at the time). In that role I rapidly became familiarized with UX research methodologies and best practices, all while leading and supporting other researchers on various projects across all points of product development.  Before this, I worked as a Research Program Manager at Alaska Airlines, working closely with business partners throughout the system to improve our customer’s experience.  

Professional Summary - What do I bring to the table?

Market and UX research professional with close to a decade of experience. In that time, I’ve developed skills in data driven marketing strategy, usability, playtesting, storytelling with data, account/client management, project management (both nationally and internationally), and collaboration with teams big and small.  

Self-starter and independent learner that takes pride in assuming responsibility and delivering results. Not settling for being told what to do, but actively seeking out what I should be doing to push toward business objectives. 

Lifelong gamer with in-depth understanding of the industry as a whole and specific franchises including Halo, Super Smash Brothers, Heroes of the Storm, Uncharted, and Final Fantasy. I am a former esports athlete that continues to follow multiple scenes closely. In a previous role I was the video game subject matter expert within my organization, in which I led and consulted on numerous projects with that focus. 

I also host, produce, edit, and market a gaming podcast about once a month and produce/host a 24hr charity stream once a year with about $13k raised lifetime for NAMI.

bio: Sound designer and composer with experience in the music, film, and video game industries. Skilled at working in REAPER, Pro Tools, Sibelius, Cubase, Dorico 2, Adobe Premiere, Wwise, and Unity. Graduated from Minnesota State University, Mankato with an interdisciplinary studies degree in Music, Music Industry, and Film, studied Game Design at Hogeschool van Arnhem en Nijmegen (HAN), in the Netherlands, and graduated with a Masters in Music Technology at Georgia Southern University.

name: Daniel K.
headline: Insights Analyst, ERG Leader
creator: FALSE
bio:
Driving actionable insights at Riot Games, my analytical acumen merges with creative marketing strategies to empower brand managers and game producers. My role involves transforming complex data into tangible plans, leveraging tools such as Tableau and Looker Studio to develop comprehensive marketing dashboards that track content engagement across diverse platforms.

At RCLCO, I cultivated a robust online marketing reporting infrastructure, collaborating with Business Intelligence teams to automate systems using Python and various APIs. This background in analytical leadership and automation design underscores my commitment to optimizing processes and growth within a data-centric marketing landscape.

name: Eric Bailey
headline: Senior Director - Software Engineering for League of Legends at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
current_position: Senior Director - Software Engineering, League of Legends
school_1: Mira Mesa High School, San Diego
bio:
I always have a deep passion for building amazing teams to develop great software and have fun.  I like to lead with empathy and bring teams along while helping individuals grow.  I'm a strong advocate for diversity and inclusiveness and enjoy having folks who bring a unique perspective to the team.

I'm a nerd at heart, and enjoy learning about many aspects of technology.  I enjoy hard challenges from a technical, organizational, and people perspective.  It's what keeps the job fun!

At Riot, we have many opportunities for bright-minded, smart individuals who are gamers at their core who enjoy solving hard problems at scale for over 100 million players.  If you're interested, reach out to me, or visit our site (https://www.riotgames.com/en/work-with-us/welcome).

name: Dominic F.
headline: Producing Content for Teamfight Tactics @ Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
I have performed various roles in entertainment and tech for 11 years. A young film director and writer entering the entertainment industry in Los Angeles at the boom of digital content, my passion for creating quickly transitioned from traditional film to online mediums; partly by choice but mostly for survival as a creative starting his career at a transitional period for both industries.

My first journey, made up of many stories with journeys of their own, took me from director to editor to documentarian to photographer to post-production supervisor over seven eventful years, culminating in the exit from then-ViacomCBS and entertainment altogether — or so I thought.

Apparently the only person that enjoyed geometry proofs, after leaving Los Angeles and doing some soul searching, my love for logic puzzles and consumer technology led me to code. I taught myself web development over 6 months and decided to attend a Le Wagon program to jump start my life's next chapter of web and application development with the intention of using my new skills to contribute to initiatives focused on accessible and engaging educational technology.

As a lifelong gamer heavily inspired by interactive mediums and the power of play, I aimed to incorporate elements of game design into my creations to encourage a natural love for learning. Over the following few tech-focused years, I went from web developer to user interface engineer to product manager to program manager until a reconnection with an old friend and former supervisor led me to my current position: Content Producer at Riot Games.

Seemingly a left turn but more of a strangely full circle moment, my adventure brought me here, where I’m now able to utilize many of the skills I’ve gathered over the years to produce content for the #1 global strategy game, Teamfight Tactics, alongside a stellar cast of Rioters. My understanding and empathy for creatives as a former creative myself, my love for games and the benefits it can have on an individual and societal level, and my sometimes-annoyingly inherent attention to detail allows me to produce engaging, creative marketing content — on time and up to very high standards; all with a smile on my face because I feel very fortunate to enjoy what I do, with an amazing team, on a product I care about, attached to lore I love, and for a company I’ve been a fan of for over a decade. Quelle chance!

name: Rosanina (Nina) Estrella
headline: Senior UX Designer at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
past_company_1: Ministry of Education of New Zealand
bio:
Hi friends 👋 I'm a UX/UI Product Designer with over 9 years experience in UX/UI, Digital Design and Information Design. Currently, I design Social Features for VALORANT Console and PC. 

Creating inclusive, accessible experiences is my passion, and empowering people to change the world is my mission. In everything I do, I put people at the forefront. I'm ambitious, driven, and thrive in challenging environments. My relationship building skills are empathy-driven, and relationship-focused. Whenever I work with others, I strive to create supportive, trusting, and high-energy environments and bring everyone along on the journey.  

While I have strong practical multi-disciplinary skills in both UX, UI, digital design, presentation design and data visualization skills, I enjoy getting head deep into design strategy and strategic delivery. Managing ambition with feasibility while balancing a big picture vision with the finer details is key to both short and long-term success for me. 

In my spare time I love boulding and playing video games. 


✨ MENTORING
I have been mentoring intern, graduate and junior designers for more than 7 years. As a young designer who was fortunate to receive valuable mentors, I love to give back to the design community and take on a few mentees every year. I primarily mentor students from the Victoria University Masters of UX program and Summer of Tech, but am open to all entry level designers or those transitioning into UX.

As a mentor I like to:
• Provide feedback on design porftolios and CVs and work with new designers to get job ready
• Support while going thought the job hunting process
• Mock interview practice
• Design career path and advice 
• Transitioning into UX/UI design/UX Research
• Public speaking, presentations and building confidence as a designer.

I currently have no long-term mentoring capacity at the moment, but happy to have a chat – flick me a DM~.

✨ HACKATHONS
I fell in love with participating in hackathons, design sprints and game jams while at university and it's become a big part of who I am as a designer! I have participated in over 40+ events and started Hackathons New Zealand in 2019 to encourage more people to participate. I even take the photography at some of them!

I love connecting with creatives and people in tech – send me a message if you want to chat!

name: Yong Woon Yap
headline: Software Engineer @ Riot Games
creator: FALSE
past_company_2: Singapore Institute of Technology Gamers' Guild
bio:
Hello!
I'm Yong Woon, currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science and Game Design with a minor in Mathematics. I'm currently studying in my Final Year at DigiPen Institute of Technology (Singapore), honing my skills and diving deeper into software development in my pursuit of knowledge. Actively working on game projects, be it for school or personal, I double as a Tools / Systems programmer as well as a Producer. 

In my school projects, the pure emotional excitement of seeing my project built piece by piece with the work of people from multiple disciplines is something I will never get tired of. That motivates me to give my all for every project that I work on; the ability to simply try something new, or better myself.

In my own time, I enjoy experimenting with Robotics. I have worked with hardware like Arduino, NXT, and EV3 to build simple prototypes for a physical proof of concepts that I come up with.

bio:
Make Gamers Care
Interested in merging the worlds of Games and Entertainment through immersive and compelling experiences. Mostly trying to get people to see a picture that doesn't exist yet.

Marketing Creative Director with a decade+ experience working in games and the larger entertainment industry. Proven success delivering user-focused 360` creative that fulfills strategic business objectives. Hands on Leader for directing all phases of creative development—from concept through production—across various media channels, formats, platforms, products and devices for a global audience.

Currently at Riot Games developing creative for League of Legends and beyond.

name: Chad Breeden
headline: Researcher and USAF Veteran
creator: FALSE
school_1: Wilbur O. and Ann Powers College of Business at Clemson University
bio:
A UX Researcher with a broad background and fondness for roleplaying games and creative thinking.

A Notre Dame and Clemson grad, he's also a veteran officer of the United States Air Force. He's putting an Industrial and Organizational Psychology Master's degree, 10 years of UX and Human Factors research experience, and a heart of gold to work in the civilian sector.

Bonus: at 5'18", he will change smoke detector batteries and clean ceiling fans free of charge.

Feel free to contact him at chad.r.breeden@gmail.com and see for yourself.

name: Pascal Allançon
headline: Manager, UX Design at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
school_1: ENJMIN - The Graduate School of Interactive Games and Interactive Medias - GAME DESIGN curriculum
school_2: Université Denis Diderot (Paris VII) - Fundamental Physics curriculum
bio:
Hello friends!
I am Pascal Allancon, French & Canadian PR, currently Manager, User Experience Design at Riot Games. I have been in the industry for 16 years & worked on 15 Games. My career started in 2008 at Ubisoft Paris, to continue in 2013 at Ubisoft Montreal. In 2019 I joined Ubisoft Singapore and now since 2021 I am a Rioter!

My background is Game Design. I have a MASTER degree of Game Design from the french school ENJMIN (National School of Digital Games and Interactive Media). All along my career I have always worked with UI/UX teams. I have specialized in the UI/UX Design field.

Before making the pivot/leap towards the video game industry, I was actually doing fundamental physics studies in order to be a teacher. I have a Bachelor degree in fundamental physics (Astrophysics & Quantum Physics specialty). It helps me, every day, understand the intricacies of video game development.  

My fascination with gaming began in the late 80s. I have spent countless hours immersed in classic Nintendo titles such as Mario & Zelda on the NES, sparking a lifelong love for games. As a self-proclaimed Nintendo fanboy, these early experiences continue to inspire my approach to game design and user experience.

Eventually I want to say that, this sentence from SATORU IWATA, resonates a lot with me: “What interests me is helping people (whether it is Players or Team Members) to enjoy themselves. Seeing the people around me looking pleased is what keeps me going”. 

Specialties: 
GAME DESIGN (UI/UX): 
* HUDs 
* Menus
* 3Cs (Controls)
* Game Structure & Macro Flow
* Social, Online, Session
* Progression
* Monetization

SKILLS:
* MATHEMATIC for System Design
* ERGONOMIC for Interface Design
* LEARNING for Progression Design

IMDb but for Games is IvgDb ;) :
Worked on 15 Games in 2 Video Games Companies: 
* 3 years @ Riot Games (2021-now)
** Teamfight Tactics
** VALORANT 
* 13 years @ Ubisoft (2008-2021) 
** 1 Game credited as a “Special Thanks” (actually “UX Director”): Skull & Bones
** 1 GaaS Game credited as UX Designer: For Honor
** 1 Mobile & Console Application & Website credited as UX Designer: Ubisoft Club
** 1 GaaS Game credited as Game Designer (UI/UX): Rainbow Six Siege
** 10 Games credited as a Line Designer:
** Splinter Cell Blacklist
** Ghost Recon Online
** Ghost Recon: Future Soldier
** I Am Alive
** From DUST
** Ghost Recon: Shadow Wars
** Ghost Recon: Predator
** Shaun White Snowboarding
* SACD (Society of Dramatic Authors & Composers) Special Jury price & Audio Direction price for student project “Fear Window"

name: Matt Costa
headline: Principal Creative Director at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
I’m a storyteller.  My career experience has all been about finding new ways to deliver deep, meaningful story driven experiences.

In my current role as a Principal Creative Director on the League of Legends Marketing team I write, direct and develop storytelling content for League of Legends.  I’m always looking for ways to tell relatable stories about our champions that enrich the game experience for players.  This starts with the notion that champions are people too and is amplified by setting them in the rich fantasy world of Runeterra.  I’ve implemented this mindset while working on some of the largest scale creative pieces and expressions of the IP that Riot has delivered outside of the game.  Most notably I've led our Season campaign, including the cinematics, multiple times and the launch of Senna, one of League’s most resonant champions.  On these projects I led the team as the creative director and also did hands-on work, developing, writing and directing the story pieces.

In some of my previous experiences, like my work with SIGGRAPH and my Master’s Degree from CMU, I focused on expanding my knowledge of technical tools that would give me more options as a creative.  This knowledge has also helped me to become a more effective leader by strengthening my ability to communicate with individual contributors through a better understanding of craft.  

As a leader I strive to create a healthy collaborative environment by first developing a clear vision for the project and then communicating it to the team.  This allows each team member to be creative while still contributing to a cohesive story experience for our audience.

My passion for storytelling, technical expertise and leadership abilities are the tools I rely on to deliver experiences that I hope are as meaningful to the audience as they are to me.

See my work at https://www.mattcosta.me/

name: Brennan Anderson
headline: Legend
creator: FALSE
bio: I am a composer and technical sound designer with a passion for effective storytelling through audio. From Austin originally, I was surrounded by music and creativity my entire life and quickly worked my way into a career in game audio. I love video games because they are a great medium to tell stories, make social commentaries, and affect perceptions of various aspects of life, something which I am drawn to furthering through the artistic implementation of audio.

name: Michael Thorne
headline: Software Engineer at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
Super happy at Riot Games and not looking for work.  

Some things I love:
- Node.js
- Responsive Web UX and Engineering 
- Service based application architecture
- Agile processes
- Communication: Building team cohesion through healthy dialogue.  I believe that nothing has more impact on a team than their ability to communicate well.
- Requirements gathering: Yeah .. I know it sounds boring, but it's if a project gets off to the wrong start by not asking the right questions, then you'll waste a lot of time and effort.  Asking the right questions to find the heart of an issue is essential to building an effective product.

bio:
Hello, I'm Rodger.

As a creative communicator, I craft stories and communicate messages across various platforms with purpose and intention. My passion for storytelling started in 2016 when I graduated from the University of Puget Sound with a Bachelor's in Anthropology and Sociology, which led me to work with Riot Games as an ethnographer and storyteller on the documentary series "Live/Play."

Building upon my undergraduate experience, I earned my Master's in Digital Media Communication from the University of Washington in 2020. During my graduate studies, I honed my skills working in communications for the Center for an Informed Public, producing content for the UW show "Coexisting with COVID," and serving as a volunteer communication consultant for a local nonprofit helping businesses navigate their newfound digital landscape. 

With my education and experience, I returned to MXTreality, a Virtual Reality company where I had previously worked, to lead their marketing and communications efforts. Using XR platforms, I told stories for clients and launched our first game, Adventure Climb VR. I'm an avid rock climber and have been coaching various climbing teams alongside my schooling and work at MXTreality up until I joined Riot Games late in 2020. At Riot Games, I've been communicating with players since the release of our fourth set, with biweekly patch notes, vlogs, trailers, copywriting, long-form editorial content, social posts, press releases and events, interviews... you name it! You can see some of my work at https://teamfighttactics.leagueoflegends.com/en-us/news/.

name: Sabrina Yesmin
headline: Project Analyst @ Riot Games | RA @ IIUC
creator: TRUE
bio:
I am a dedicated professional with a strong background in user interface design, project analysis, and game design across technology and education sectors.

Currently, I serve as a User Interface Designer for the NASA International Space Apps Challenge, where I focus on developing intuitive and user-friendly interfaces. In addition, I work as a Research Assistant at International Islamic University Chittagong, applying data analysis and Python programming to support engineering projects.

In my role as a Project Analyst for Riot Games, I enhance project workflows and facilitate data-driven decision-making within teams. My experience as a Teaching Assistant has strengthened my ability to mentor students in programming and complex problem-solving.

Previously, I worked as a Game Design Consultant at Level Infinite, contributing to various game development initiatives aimed at improving gameplay experiences.

Key Skills:

User Interface Design
Data Analysis
Python Programming
Game Design

I am committed to leveraging technology and design to address real-world challenges and continually seek opportunities that promote innovation and collaboration.

name: Berker Siino
headline: Associate Art Director at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
Hi there, I am Berker Siino. Associate Art Director at Riot Games, husband and dad of 3 kids! :)
The first time I got in contact with video games was literally chewing on my brother's Commodore 64 cords. Basically, I got hooked every since.

I started my career in the games industry in 2008 at Crytek GmbH, located in Germany, Frankfurt am Main. I was contributing to games such as Crysis 2/3 and Ryse. Furthermore, I supported R'n'D on the development of Crytek's own engine called Cryengine. One of the jobs was to visit licensees all over the world and teach them the tech to be used in their games. After 5 years of studio experience, I decided to move on and start my own business as a freelance 3D artist for games such as Borderlands 3 and Spyro reignited trilogy.
 
July 2019, I relocated with my family to the USA to join Epic Games, Inc., and the Fortnite environment art team. I contributed to the Chapter 2 wormhole map release, multiple seasons, and events like the Travis Scott concert.
In January 2022, we moved to the other side of the world to join Riot Games, Inc. in Singapore to work on Valorant and unannounced R'n'D projects.

name: Justin Phang
headline: VALORANT Global Group Creative Director
creator: TRUE
bio:
____
Justin has pioneered a new department for Nike, rebuilt one for R/GA and led one for Riot Games. He has been guiding creative teams globally across timezones in Los Angeles, Shanghai, Tokyo, Sydney, Singapore, New York and Buenos Aires: one of the many reason he can come to speak 8 languages.
 
Having spent the majority of his career working with Nike, Justin now serves as the Global Group Creative Director for VALORANT at Riot Games in Los Angeles. He leads a team of talented Creative Directors, shaping work that builds entertainment IP and deepens fandom.

Many of his work has been featured by publishings across the world: including Hypebeast, Vogue and Forbes, while winning awards along the way. In 2019, he is named LinkedIn’s China Occupational Expert for Creative Industry.

I have over 17+ years of professional experience across film, tv, and games industries.

My other focus is developing scalable pipelines that define efficient workflows & tools while engaging users with friendly UX.

name: Victor Ermakov
headline: Audio Lead @ Riot Games | Interactive Audio Systems Expert
creator: FALSE
bio:
Experienced audio specialist with over a decade of expertise in video game sound design. Avid gamer and passionate about procedural audio and modular synths. Proud member of the Audio Engineering Society.

Specialties:
Game Audio, Sound Design, Audio Implementation, FMOD, WWise, Unreal Engine, Unity3D, pureData,  Symbolic Sound Kyma,  Surround Mixing, Audio Editing, Field Recording, Sound Editing, Foley Recording.

name: Diego Ferreira
headline: CEO & Co-Founder at Babi Challenge
creator: FALSE
bio:
Formado em Engenharia Civil com Pós graduação em planejamento, orçamento e controle, participei de algumas obras no Rio de Janeiro.

De 2009 a 2017 joguei competitivamente em jogos como CS 1.6, Cross Fire e CSGO. Em 2016 comecei a fazer stream por diversão e a me aventurar no mundo de negócio dos games.

Iniciei a transição de jogador para os bastidores, como um league OPS, e como já havia participado de muitos campeonatos, eu já sabia o que se passava no lado do jogador, trazendo assim resoluções mais rápidas e eficazes. 

Hoje estou à frente da empresa RedCat Produtora, e a principal atividade dela é fomentar o cenário de esports através da elaboração total de programas, eventos e campeonatos de várias modalidades. Atualmente estamos bastante focados no Taça das Minas com apoio da Riot (Game Changers Academy de Valorant), onde já realizamos algumas edições. Além dele, já realizamos muitos outros eventos, inclusive em parceria com a Riot como foi o Ravenão (Game Changers de Wild Rift em 2022).

Estou à frente de todos os pontos desses eventos, desde o planejamento, elaboração de bracket, league ops, regulamento, estratégia de divulgação, transmissão, entre outros. Tudo na RedCat passa pela minha aprovação para sua continuidade.

Além da RedCat Produtora, também estou a frente do portal de notícias e conteúdos PontoZero GG e da equipe de influenciadores BC Esports. 

No PontoZero GG trazemos coberturas presencialmente ou não dos principais campeonatos e eventos. Nossa primeira cobertura presencial foi no VCT Lockin, campeonato mundial de valorant que aconteceu em São Paulo, depois participamos do CBLOL e Game Changers, e muitos outros campeonatos remotamente. Com o PontoZero GG buscamos sempre estar dentro da comunidade, trazendo a opinião daqueles que fazem o cenário acontecer, o público. Já no BC Esports nós geramos conteúdos em canais de streaming 24 horas por dia, além de podcasts, campeonatos/projetos que buscam fortalecer as comunidades menos visadas como: PCD, LGBTQIA+, FEMININA, RACIAL, dentre outras.

Os esports e games estão presentes diariamente na minha vida, além de gostar de jogar, acompanho muitos campeonatos oficiais, notícias, atualizações e alguns torneios de comunidade, já que estou a frente também do torneio Babi Challenge Ladies e Misto que acontecem semanalmente, este também em parceria com a Riot.

Levo comigo uma frase "É diferente quando se faz por amor!" e ela diz muito sobre como me sinto trabalhando com jogos e conteúdos, amo o que faço e isso me motiva a sempre querer fazer mais.

name: Ashish Gupta
headline: Marketing Lead - India & South Asia at Riot Games
creator: TRUE
current_position: Marketing Lead - India and South Asia
school_1: C-DAC - DACA -Mumbai Educational Trust(Mumbai), Pune University
school_2: PGD IMSIT Advertising & Marketing, YMCA New Delhi
bio:
Ashish Gupta is a recognized leader in the gaming industry with over 20 years of work experience. He is currently working as Marketing Lead for India and South Asia at Riot Games.

Prior to joining Riot Games,  Ashish worked as Assistant Vice President at Reliance Jio and led Games Ecosystem at for Games Stores for Jio VoLTE Feature Phones, Smart Phones, Setup Boxes, Cloud Gaming, VR, and eSports.

Before Jio Ashish worked as Country Manager- India, Sri Lanka & Bangladesh with Gameloft, and was responsible for managing, leading, and growing the overall business for OEMs, Carriers, Advertising, App Stores, and D2C. He was instrumental in setting the ball rolling for Gameloft Advertising business verticals in India and worked with leading brands and media agencies like Airtel, Apple, Coca-Cola, Myntra, Maruti, OMD, Isobar, Mediacom, Mindshare etc. Under his leadership, India team won many accolades for games and ad campaigns like National Digital Marketing Awards, Drivers of Digital, Mobby’s, to name a few.  

He worked at  Gameloft a vast amount of experience with his expertise in technical, graphic, game designing, mobile ads,research and industry analysis. Prior to joining Gameloft, he has worked with Reliance Games, India Games and Real Networks focusing on business strategy, marketing and analysis. 

He started his career in gaming as a Graphic Artist and actively worked on top-notch AAA branded games. He was also involved in Game Design for the Asian market of BREW/ Symbian devices. His key strengths lie in Game designing, conceptualization, Game Analysis  Game merchandising,  Publishing, Marketing, Affiliation, Mobile Ad Sales, Networking, and Research. 

While working with Reliance Games, Ashish had a significant role in achieving the No. 2 position as a publisher on Nokia Store & 100 % growth in telecom VAS &  ad revenue. 
He also successfully launched Games Portal for 3G and the new Airtel Live brand launch.

Ashish believes that effective leadership is the true mark of greatness and is the mark of a focused and aligned organization.

name: Mohamed Gambouz
headline: Director, Art Direction @ Riot Games - Hong Kong & Singapore Studio
creator: FALSE
current_position: Director, Art Direction @ Riot Games - Hong Kong & Singapore Studio
bio:
MOHAMED GAMBOUZ

Holds a BAC degree in Fine Arts from the Casablanca Technical School in Morocco, where he was born. Back then, already having a great passion for games, he developed small games, demos and prototypes on the Amiga 500 with a group of friends.

He made his debut as a Character Animator at Ubisoft Casablanca in 1998 when he was still 18 years old. 2 years later, he progressed to the role of Artistic Director and in the following months, he worked on titles such as Rayman 3, Beyond Good & Evil and Prince of Persia: The Sands Of Time.

In 2005, he moved to Montreal to work as a Senior Level Artist on Prince of Persia 3 and Assassin's Creed 1. After which, Gambouz worked as an Art Director on Assassin's Creed 2, Assassin's Creed Brotherhood and Assassin's Creed Unity. He is now at Ubisoft Singapore (since 2015) working as a World Director and Art Director on the Assassin’s creed brand and on Skull & Bones.

He is passionate about the arts, especially classical and primitive arts. His artistic senses are also tickled whenever art crosses over with science and imagination (like video games). He loves to travel and get inspiration from the different cultures he encounters.

name: Alex Carlyle
headline: Development Leadership at Riot Games
creator: TRUE
bio:
I have been privileged to work on a number of successful AAA Console and PC titles through their complete product life-cycles, allowing me to develop a wealth of design, production and leadership experience in shipping games.

An explorer at heart I thrive in an environment that is driven by challenging convention. With a deep passion for design, I am a dynamic creative that champions the core user experience. I use an open and inclusive design methodology and thrive in bringing order out of chaos. With a knack for keeping the big picture in mind, I employ exceptional communication skills and a detail-orientated approach to problems, without losing sight of the need to be creative and flexible.

I am personally driven, have a deep understanding of game development and software as a service. I have recruited and built strong teams from the ground up and worked across both large-scale distributed development and start-up businesses.

name: Yannick Gerber
headline: Senior Engineering Manager at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
With 25 years of experience in the video game industry, I am a Senior Software Engineering Manager with a passion for building and leading high-performing teams and delivering exceptional gaming experiences. My career has spanned multiple AAA online titles, across several platforms (PC, PlayStation, Xbox), where I’ve specialized in gameplay programming, UI/UX design, and scalable system architecture.

I've had the privilege of leading cross-functional teams, scaling engineering departments, and driving critical projects for companies like Riot Games and Ubisoft, from conceptualization to release. A dedicated advocate for agile methodologies, I am involved in university outreach programs, nurturing the next generation of game engineers, and leading internship initiatives.

Some of my notable achievements include establishing best-in-class UI frameworks at Ubisoft, and scaling Riot Games’ Singapore engineering team to meet the demands of global products like League of Legends, Teamfight Tactics and 2xKO.

I have proudly contributed to:
▪ League of Legends
▪ Teamfight Tactics 
▪ Skull and Bones
▪ Assassin’s Creed Origins
▪ End War Online
▪ Trials Fusion
▪ Assassin’s Creed: Black Flag
▪ Assassin’s Creed 3
▪ Assassin’s Creed: Revelations
▪ Driver: San Francisco
▪ Assassin’s Creed: Brotherhood
▪ Assassin’s Creed 2
▪ Dark Messiah of Might and Magic 
▪ Splinter Cell: Double Agent 
▪ Splinter Cell: Chaos Theory 
▪ Splinter Cell: Pandora Tomorrow
▪ Largo Winch: Empire Under Threat
▪ Rayman: Revolution
▪ Rayman 2

creator: FALSE
current_position: Director, League of Legends Esports, EMEA
bio: I am currently the Director for League of Legends Esports in EMEA at Riot Games. In this role, I am leading the product teams responsible for the LEC, TCL, LCL, the European Regional Leagues & European Masters. During my tenure at Riot Games, I have has also held the roles of the Head of Esports as well as LEC Commissioner where I was responsible for the day-to-day operations of the LEC as well as oversight of the operations of the European Regional Leagues. Prior to joining Riot Games, I worked for startups in the gaming industry where I led teams responsible for launching games on mobile and desktop.

name: Sam Minehan
headline: Producer, Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
With experience in video games Production, specialising in technical production and cross functional team facilitation, I have built up a wide skillset of agile and waterfall methodologies to apply to software based industries along with great communication and team leadership skills. In current and past positions I have been able to assist management through transitional periods in order to achieve greater business profits as well as customer and team satisfaction, working to guide and lift the team up. Furthermore I acted as a critical bridge between businesses, clients and outsourcers to facilitate cross functional teams and pipelines.

In looking for opportunities within the Games Production in Sydney I have project lead and developed multiple projects independant of my work at Blowfish Studios, as well as particpated and helped establish multiple Game Jams in the Sydney area. Additionally my interests lie in developing and managing content for games such as Dungeons and Dragons 5th Edition, League of Legends and World of Warcraft where I document changes that could be made to these titles to fix problems brought up by their respective communities. I have further involved myself in these communities over the years, exhibiting leadersip and analytical skills, acting as a head coach for the Oceanic Challenger Scene (OCS) in League of Legends and, over the years, raid leading at a top Oceanic level in World of Warcraft in guilds such as <One>, <The Stylish Few> and <Content>.

name: Vincent Ménier
headline: Associate Art Director at Riot Games / 2XKO
creator: FALSE
bio:
Art Director & Game Developer with over 10 years experience. I have worked on a wide range of projects, from 1 year mobile productions with a small agile team to multi-studio AAA titles with a 5+ years dev cycle. 

Currently, I lead a multidisciplinary team of creatives at Riot Games, working on 2XKO: a 2v2 Fighting Game set in the League of Legends universe.

I’m passionate about people, whether it is the team members I collaborate with, the players I work for, or the inspiring characters that live in our digital worlds. Moreover, I believe in games as an elegant medium for learning and human interaction.

Focus on: Creative Decisiveness - Player Focus / Team Growth - Communication

name: Michael Yeo
headline: Quality Assurance Engineer III at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
My name is 'Michael' Yeo Fei Wen. I am a Science and IT graduate, major in Programming, from Queensland University of Technology (QUT). Software development, especially video game development is one of my core interest. 

Currently a Quality Assuranc Engineer situated in Riot Games Singapore. My current position allows me to work closely with developers and designers to ascertain proper testing criteria. So as to achieve the top quality game features planned for the project. 

General QA activites include embedding within multiple feature teams, collate and collecting relative information pertaining to feature dependencies and providing such information to respective stakeholders and testers of other teams. Communication with international studios regarding feature and test case updates. Encourage agile methodology practises in embedded teams and participate in scrums and sprints.

name: Jorge A.
headline: Latin America Influencer Manager @ Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio: Director de contenido. Experto en desarrollo de estrategias y en creación, análisis, optimización y administración de contenidos digitales. Dirección altamente eficiente tanto de equipos como freelancers y proveedores gracias a una demostrada habilidad como facilitador y a una dirección creativa sólida orientada a resultados. Más de 10 años de experiencia en la creación de estrategias de comunicación con las mejores prácticas en redes sociales, web y SEO. Administrador de proyectos editoriales multimedia, inbound marketing y branded content tanto para medios locales líderes como para compañías del Fortune 500 de la rama del entretenimiento, medios, tecnología de consumo y los videojuegos.

name: Anton W.
headline: Scaling Riot's production capacity
creator: FALSE
bio:
25 years of AAA game development experience, contributing to 15+ games, living and working in Stockholm > Shanghai > Amsterdam > Hong Kong > Seoul > Singapore. Specializing in taking productions from 0 to 1, shipping games, and increasing value from 1x to 10X. Player-focused, proactive, pragmatic, professional problem-solver.

Franchises worked on: League of Legends, VALORANT, Team Fight Tactics, Horizon Zero Dawn, Battlefield, Killzone, Medal of Honor, Need for Speed, Mirror's Edge etc.

name: Kevin Forcet
headline: Senior Manager, Product Guy & Factotum at Riot Games
creator: FALSE
bio:
I have experience in every step of the process, from strategy to development to launching to running live products. The variety of positions I have occupied in my career have given me a clear understanding of how to make things happen online. As a result, I am at ease managing interdisciplinary projects from start to finish… and beyond.

As for the rest:
- I dream the dreams and do the maths!
- I love building things and solving puzzles
- I'm the calm one, but I run towards fires
- The tougher the challenge, the happier I am
- Nothing is so serious than you can’t have fun, and be fun, doing it

I’m always happy to meet people and discuss cool ideas, so please do get in touch if you’d like to have a chat

Specialties: Product Strategy, Product Management, Product Development, Product Design, Product Launch, Live Operations, User Research, Product research, Data Collection, Data Analysis, Leadership, Staffing, Stakeholder Management, Social Media, Community Management, Monetisation, International Environments.

name: Grazielle Almeida
headline: Esports | TFT Brazil Community & Operations Lead | Product Owner | Project Manager
creator: TRUE
bio: Com mais de dez anos de experiência profissional, estou atualmente liderando a comunidade e as operações de TFT no Brasil na Riot Games, onde habilidades de comunicação e coordenação de equipe e fornecedores são fundamentais. Minha missão é impulsionar a cena de eSports, alinhando minha expertise em gerenciamento de projetos e operações de ligas com os valores e metas da Riot Games. Dentro da empresa, sou reconhecida por trazer perspectivas diversas e contribuir significativamente para o nosso time, sempre buscando inovação e excelência na entrega de experiências memoráveis para a comunidade de jogadores.

name: Kevin Nash
headline: Lead Character Artist @ Riot Games
creator: TRUE
bio: I'm Kevin Nash, a character artist of nearly seven years, specializing in stylized realism with a robust technical background. I've worn many hats, from mentoring junior artists to designing modular character systems, sculpting wolves to texturing trolls, and honing on my craft to motivate and inspire.

name: 陳胤安
headline: RIOT Illustration & concept team leader from Singapore
creator: FALSE
bio:
◆RIOT Legends of Runeterr Concept Art Team Leader from Singapore
◆Through the cooperation with KUDOS and RIOT, I have more than 3 years of concept art experience. And, a total of 6 years of concept art experience in Taiwan.
◆More than 8 years of experience in game art education.
◆More than 10 years of experience of establishing a game studio; publishing industry ◆related books and art outsourcing cooperation.
◆Passionate about exploring and learning various styles of design.
◆I believe that a well-designed shape language can make product packaging more attractive, and can lead to a series of unique story creations.
◆Artststiom : https://www.artstation.com/loizachen

bio:

    He wants to be one of the greatest artists in the world with hard work.

bio:
Hi I'm Audrey, a passionate creative mind with 11 years of professional experience.
I was born and raised in France and I am now living my Esports dream working for Riot Games in Berlin.

I am skilled in building creative visions and delivering design solutions to fulfill strategic goals with skills including brand development, illustration, logo design, icon design, packaging design, apparel design, print design, and large-format printing.
